Title: Data Scientist Junior - Inteligencia Artificial
Description:
More digital. More human. More Minsait.

En Minsait creemos en un futuro digital más humano; por eso, ofrecemos proyectos tecnológicos que transforman los negocios y nos permiten crecer como profesionales desde una cultura inspiradora y flexible.

Buscamos personas brillantes y creativas para formar parte de nuestro equipo de Inteligencia Artificial, donde abordamos proyectos de vanguardia en el ámbito de la IA Generativa. Desde la creación de arte generativo hasta la resolución de problemas complejos utilizando redes neuronales, nuestro equipo está a la vanguardia de la revolución tecnológica. Si te apasionan los proyectos retadores y quieres generar impacto social, sostenible y tangible, ¡sigue leyendo!




En Minsait, crecer y transformar es posible. ¿Te unes al reto?

Tendrás la oportunidad de trabajar en proyectos emocionantes, colaborar con compañeros excepcionales y contribuir al desarrollo de soluciones innovadoras que cambiarán el mundo.
Estarás en contacto continuo con las novedades tecnológicas, impulsando la transformación digital.
Participarás en proyectos y desarrollos que tienen una alta visibilidad y que marcan la diferencia con soluciones disruptivas y especializadas para toda la cadena de valor.
Colaborarás con referentes tecnológicos del sector que serán tu inspiración y en los que te reflejarás para seguir creciendo profesionalmente.




¿Qué esperamos por tu parte?

Que seas recién Titulado/a en Grado Universitario en Ingeniería Informática, Estadística, Ciencia de Datos, Telecomunicaciones, Telemática; también valorables personas que dispongan de Máster orientado a Big Data, Data Science, Inteligencia Artificial, Computación Lingüística, además de poseer el Grado.
Conocimientos de programación tales como NLP, Python, R.
Buena capacidad analítica, de comunicación y habilidades interpersonales.
Nivel de Inglés B2




Sé parte de un futuro más humano. Motivos por los que te encantará ser un #Minsaiter:

Compañía Top Employer con más de 45.000 profesionales y con acceso a proyectos retadores.
Conciliación y equilibrio: podrás disfrutar de 32 días laborables de descanso, jornada intensiva en verano y teletrabajo.
Carrera profesional y formación continua adaptada a tus necesidades y motivaciones.
Contrato Indefinido y retribución competitiva, seguro de vida y acceso a planes de retribución flexible: cheques restaurante, cheques guardería, tarjeta de transporte o seguro médico privado.
Programa de bienestar con acceso a una red de gimnasios, servicio de telemedicina en línea gratuita y otras ventajas como aplicaciones para hacer tu declaración de la renta más fácil, asesoría legal gratuita y nuestra Privilege Store.
Cultura empática, humana y flexible: promovemos un liderazgo cercano marcado por la colaboración y el trabajo en equipo. Contamos con espacios donde podrás compartir tus aficiones, hobbies e intereses con otros profesionales y si quieres dejar tu huella en el mundo, no dudes en participar en nuestro programa de voluntariado.




Minsait, technology for a more human future!

Nuestro compromiso es promover ambientes de trabajo en los que se trate con respeto y dignidad a las personas, procurando el desarrollo profesional de la plantilla y garantizando la igualdad de oportunidades en su selección, formación y promoción ofreciendo un entorno de trabajo libre de cualquier discriminación por motivo de género, edad, discapacidad, orientación sexual, identidad o expresión de género, religión, etnia, estado civil o cualquier otra circunstancia personal o social.

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
About Fusemachines

Fusemachines is a 10+ year old AI company, dedicated to delivering state-of-the-art AI products and solutions to a diverse range of industries. Founded by Sameer Maskey, Ph.D., an Adjunct Associate Professor at Columbia University, our company is on a steadfast mission to democratize AI and harness the power of global AI talent from underserved communities. With a robust presence in four countries and a dedicated team of over 400 full-time employees, we are committed to fostering AI transformation journeys for businesses worldwide. At Fusemachines, we not only bridge the gap between AI advancement and its global impact but also strive to deliver the most advanced technology solutions to the world.

About The Role

This is a remote, contract based role for 3 - 6 months with possibility of extension. As a Data Scientist, you will play a crucial role in designing, developing, and implementing Machine Learning models and Generative AI solutions. You will work closely with ML Engineers, Data Engineers, and other stakeholders to ensure our AI applications are robust, scalable, and impactful.

Roles And Responsibilities

Your responsibilities will include, but are not limited to:


Own and develop Machine Learning solutions to solve unstructured, complex business problems
Maintain and optimize existing Machine Learning solutions and improve them with more efficient methods
Monitor models’ performance in production to ensure the highest quality level, report on development status, identify risk areas and support the Data Science team
Build state-of-the-art & cost-efficient solutions leveraging GenAI models for multiple use cases (summarisation, classification, chatbots)
Perform statistical analysis on existing and new datasets to help SME stakeholders identify areas for improvement
Communicate technical solutions to non-technical stakeholders successfully
Research new methods and techniques in AI/ML to improve processes and methodologies


Required Skills

The individual applying for this role must have 2-4 years of experience as a Data Scientist building production-ready Machine Learning solutions.


Experience with common Machine Learning frameworks and methods and developing business-oriented data solutions (e.g., data mining, process optimization, predictive modeling)
Experience building GenAI solutions with LLMs and familiarity with both open-source and Proprietary LLMs
Proficiency in using Databricks for developing and managing machine learning workflows
A background in a quantitative discipline (Computer Science, Maths, Statistics, Engineering), or a PhD with a focus on quantitative methodologies. Don’t be afraid to apply for this role if you come from a different background, as long as you have relevant experience
Strong coding skills: Python (it’s a must), SQL, PySpark, and R are used across multiple projects
Hands-on experience with Machine Learning libraries such as Scikit-Learn, TensorFlow, Keras, PyTorch, or H2O
Hands-on experience with LLMs to build RAG solutions using Hugging Face, LangChain, and/or OpenAI models
Problem-solving skills, critical thinking, and a creative mindset
Excellent written and verbal communication
Excellent organizational, problem-solving, and communication skills
Ability to thrive in a fast-paced, rapidly changing environment and remain composed under pressure
A good level of English is expected (C1/C2)


Fusemachines is an Equal Opportunities Employer, committed to diversity and inclusion. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or any other characteristic protected by law.

Powered by JazzHR

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
About Clarity AI

Clarity AI is a global tech company founded in 2017 committed to bringing societal impact to markets. We leverage AI and machine learning technologies to provide investors, governments, companies, and consumers with the right data, methodologies, and tools to make more informed decisions.

We are now a team of more than 300 highly passionate individuals from all over the world. Together, we have established Clarity AI as a leading sustainability tech company backed by investors and strategic partners such as SoftBank, BlackRock, and Deutsche Börse, who believe in us and share our goals. We are dedicated to cultivating an exceptional workplace environment. We take pride in our culture, defined by our commitment to being fact-based, diverse, transparent, meritocratic, and flexible.

We have plans to continue growing our teams globally, so if you would like to join us on this rocket ship, keep reading! 📚Your work will shape and guide the sustainable decisions of investors, companies and consumers worldwide.

About The Role

We are looking for a Data Scientist with a strong scientific mindset and enough experience to help us bring societal impacts to market and make a difference. You would be part of a team of +20 international Data Scientists coming from top Academic Institutions and Tech Companies with a shared passion for data science and a growing mindset.

For more insight into the technologies used by the engineering team at Clarity AI, please explore our Tech Stack

What You'll Be Doing

Working as a Data Scientist you will be responsible for:


Monitoring and maintaining machine learning and other data science products already in production
Building new models end-to-end
Analyzing complex data sets autonomously
Participating in the development of proofs of concept
Keeping always an eye on the business needs & opportunities.
Communicating with a diverse set of stakeholders with different backgrounds


Location

The role is based in Madrid ( Remote / Hybrid )

Requirements

What You'll Need

If you feel it in your guts apply anyways (we are always open to find talent where least expected!), but this is the expected profile:


+2 years of experience working in Data Science products or PhD in ML / Applied Math / Quantitative Research / Statistics / Computer Science ... or any related field
High level in the Python data science ecosystem (Pandas, Matplotlib, Scikit-Learn, ...)
At least well acquainted with working in collaborative code bases (Git) and production code (beyond notebooks)
You care about sustainability and impact
You are willing to learn and share your own learnings
You are transparent and care about communicating effectively and constructively
Highly motivated, independent and deeply passionate about making an impact with data & science
Excellent oral and written English communication skills (minimum C1 level-proficient user)


Nice To Have


Experience in a start-up
Experience working with AWS or other cloud providers
Experience working with Docker, Gitlab & Airflow



Benefits


Equity Plans - ESOP / Phantom Stock: share our success!
Annual training budget to support your professional growth
Private healthcare coverage
Wellness and Fitness cover with Gympass!
Flexible Work Arrangements; We promote work-life balance through flexible schedules and remote work options
Global offices across New York, Madrid, Barcelona, London, Paris, and Abu Dhabi, and access to a global network of co-working spaces


More About Clarity AI ⭐

Clarity AI's Founder and CEO, Rebeca Minguela, is a successful entrepreneur who has been recognised by prestigious institutions like the World Economic Forum as one of the most distinguished leaders under 40.

The leadership team has an international presence and is composed of professionals from leading tech, consulting, and banking firms, entrepreneurs, PhDs from top research institutions, and MBA graduates from top business schools.

Clarity AI has received several awards:


Investment Week - Best Sustainable Investment Research & Ratings Provider 2023
Fast Company - Most Innovative Companies 2023
The Forrester New Wave Leader: ESG Ratings, Data, and Analytics 2022
European Commission | EU Seal of Excellence 2020
World Economic Forum - Technology Pioneer 2020
World Economic Forum, Young Global Leader - Rebeca Minguela


Clarity AI believes diversity, inclusion, and belonging are essential for creating an innovative and successful workplace. By actively promoting and engaging in sustainability efforts, we can help create a more equitable and resilient future for our planet and all its inhabitants.

Title: Data Scientist (Intern)
Description:
Motoreto a four-year-old company provides solutions for the B2B automotive sector. Our newest SaaS platform streamlines stock management and delivers precise market insights to car dealers across Europe.

With consistent monthly growth we now serve over 100 businesses. We re ready to invest further in our product and tech foundations to enhance our offering s quality and extend our market reach.

Tasks


Dive into data be our go-to data person taking on data-related aspects of the app with a proactive and impactful approach.
Data analysis help analyze large datasets to uncover trends patterns and anomalies related to used vehicle pricing.
Model development help develop models to standardize and predict market information.
Validation assist in designing steps to validate and report the accuracy and effectiveness of our models.
Data pipelines learn to build and automate data pipelines for efficient data processing and cleaning.
Collaboration work with our engineering team to deploy models into our SaaS platform.
Web Scraping improve data collection methods through web scraping to ensure high-quality data.
Insights provide insights and recommendations based on data analysis to help guide business decisions and strategy.


Requirements


Learning attitude we re more interested in your enthusiasm and willingness to learn than years of experience or diplomas.
Humble curious and eager to get things done.
Passion for the job any experience in data science and machine learning is a plus side projects count!
Programming skills basic knowledge of Python (preferred) R or similar languages.
Statistical skills understanding of statistical analysis and machine learning techniques. Knowledge of Natural Language Processing (NLP) is a plus.
SQL knowledge familiarity with SQL experience with database management is a bonus.
Web scraping familiarity with web scraping techniques and tools is helpful.
Professional working proficiency in English and Spanish.


Benefits

Team dynamic


We are a small efficient tech team consisting of a full-stack engineer a front-end developer and a product/design specialist.
Our size allows us to avoid complexities and politics focusing instead on clear communication and mutual respect for each other s opinions and expertise.
We work asynchronously most of the time and operate 100 remotely.
We are committed to steady growth valuing our colleagues and delivering high-quality work without compromising personal lives or mental health.
Most importantly we enjoy working and building things together. We are looking for a colleague who shares our passion for owning the product and continuously improving it.


Our offer


A small team environment with easy communication and plenty of room for making big decisions.
100 remote work and you can work from our offices in Getafe Madrid whenever you want.
Flexible working hours.
Continuous learning and professional development opportunities.
A vibrant and inclusive company culture.
Free tickets to C.D. Leganés matches in La Liga.
Free VIP tickets to Atlético de Madrid matches in La Liga.
A 3-month paid internship with the potential for a contract offer afterward based on your performance.


Don t worry if you don t meet every single requirement. If you re passionate about what you do and eager to learn we encourage you to apply! We believe that diverse perspectives and experiences make our team stronger.

Python, R, SQL

Title: Junior Data Scientist
Description:
The Opportunity

As a Junior Data Scientist, you will be joining our Analytics department working on a hybrid basis in Madrid. This role requires a high degree of proficiency in both Spanish and English and we would invite you to submit your application in English.




You will play a crucial role in helping us achieve our goals and deliver success on behalf of our customers by building advanced statistical models and algorithms that infer and predict individual customer behaviours in real-time, based on retail, online and ecommerce transaction data.




We are experiencing a continued period of great success winning big deals with customers in Latin America, as well as across the EMEA region. This has been a big factor in our decision to build an Analytics presence in Spain to support our customers. For this role you will be working with global customers that require periodic work outside of standard hours (evening work) and international travel around once a quarter.




Day to Day

Applying analytical theory to diverse real-world problems on large and dynamic datasets
Generating integral work products from project kick-off through to live deployment
Contributing to the development of statistical models and algorithms for integration within Featurespace products
End-to-end processing and modelling of large customer data sets
Producing materials to feedback analytic output to customers (reports, presentations, visualizations)
Working collaboratively with customers to develop and optimize models tailored to their data
Evaluating and improving analytical results on live systems
Developing an understanding of industry data structures and processes
Working with engineering/development teams to support and enhance the analytical infrastructure
Testing analytical models and their integration within the ARIC platform




About you

Must haves:

Good degree in a scientific or numerate discipline (e.g. Computer Science, Physics, Mathematics, Engineering) or equivalent work experience
Strong, clear, concise written and verbal communication skills in both English and Spanish
Evidence of interest in machine learning
Experience in utilising statistical models and analytical algorithms in software
Experience using Python, Java, R or another major programming language for data analysis, machine learning or algorithm development
Technical and analytical skills with the ability to pick up new technologies and concepts quickly
Problem-solving skills (especially in data-centric applications)
Strong communication skills
Ability to manage and prioritise personal workload




Great to haves:

Exposure to the handling of large, diverse, real-world data sets
Experience working in a Linux command line environment
Experience using SQL to analyse data
Experience with version control software and workflows (e.g. git)




Equal Opportunities

Here at Featurespace we are committed to being a place of equality, inclusion and respect to provide a safe environment for you to bring your authentic self to work. We know that we gain as much strength from our differences as we do our similarities. We value diversity and are dedicated to listening and learning from each other to build and maintain a positive and productive culture. We appreciate this will be an ever-evolving focus for the business to ensure everyone feels supported and has a sense of belonging.

Show more

The Opportunity

As a Junior Data Scientist, you will be joining our Analytics department working on a hybrid basis in Madrid. This role requires a high degree of proficiency in both Spanish and English and we would invite you to submit your application in English.


You will play a crucial role in helping us achieve our goals and deliver success on behalf of our customers by building advanced statistical models and algorithms that infer and predict individual customer behaviours in real-time, based on retail, online and ecommerce transaction data.


We are experiencing a continued period of great success winning big deals with customers in Latin America, as well as across the EMEA region. This has been a big factor in our decision to build an Analytics presence in Spain to support our customers. For this role you will be working with global customers that require periodic work outside of standard hours (evening work) and international travel around once a quarter.


Day to Day

  • Applying analytical theory to diverse real-world problems on large and dynamic datasets
  • Generating integral work products from project kick-off through to live deployment
  • Contributing to the development of statistical models and algorithms for integration within Featurespace products
  • End-to-end processing and modelling of large customer data sets
  • Producing materials to feedback analytic output to customers (reports, presentations, visualizations)
  • Working collaboratively with customers to develop and optimize models tailored to their data
  • Evaluating and improving analytical results on live systems
  • Developing an understanding of industry data structures and processes
  • Working with engineering/development teams to support and enhance the analytical infrastructure
  • Testing analytical models and their integration within the ARIC platform


About you

Must haves:

  • Good degree in a scientific or numerate discipline (e.g. Computer Science, Physics, Mathematics, Engineering) or equivalent work experience
  • Strong, clear, concise written and verbal communication skills in both English and Spanish
  • Evidence of interest in machine learning
  • Experience in utilising statistical models and analytical algorithms in software
  • Experience using Python, Java, R or another major programming language for data analysis, machine learning or algorithm development
  • Technical and analytical skills with the ability to pick up new technologies and concepts quickly
  • Problem-solving skills (especially in data-centric applications)
  • Strong communication skills
  • Ability to manage and prioritise personal workload


Great to haves:

  • Exposure to the handling of large, diverse, real-world data sets
  • Experience working in a Linux command line environment
  • Experience using SQL to analyse data
  • Experience with version control software and workflows (e.g. git)


Equal Opportunities

Here at Featurespace we are committed to being a place of equality, inclusion and respect to provide a safe environment for you to bring your authentic self to work. We know that we gain as much strength from our differences as we do our similarities. We value diversity and are dedicated to listening and learning from each other to build and maintain a positive and productive culture. We appreciate this will be an ever-evolving focus for the business to ensure everyone feels supported and has a sense of belonging.

Title: Beca Data Scientist
Description:
En el Programa de Becas de ACCIONA formarás parte de equipos que te involucrarán en proyectos desde el primer día, acompañado por expertos que te ayudarán a desarrollar tus capacidades y participar en el día a día de una empresa global.




Acciona, en su ámbito de Infraestructuras, oferta una beca para su departamento de Innovación, con ubicación en el campus de Madrid.




Misión:

Buscamos a una persona que se incorpore al equipo de Innovación y Transformación Digital para colaborar en el desarrollo end-to-end de proyectos de datos e IA en las áreas de actividad de ACCIONA Infraestructuras.
Trabajarás en nuestros proyectos de 'Data & AI', colaborando en el proceso de generación de valor a partir del dato de la compañía.
En un equipo en continuo crecimiento, tendrás la oportunidad de desarrollar nuevos algoritmos, modelos u otras soluciones técnicas e implementarlas en una gran variedad de disciplinas de negocio como obras de túneles, plantas de tratamiento de agua o desarrollo de negocio.
Interaccionarás con equipos híbridos con perfiles de Data Management y de varias unidades de negocio, adquiriendo una visión completa de los casos de uso a realizar.

Funciones:

Apoyar en el preprocesamiento (limpieza y preparación) de datos y análisis preliminar de conjuntos de datos para la construcción de modelos predictivos.
Ayudar en el desarrollo e implementación de modelos de aprendizaje automático.
Contribuir al proceso de refinamiento de los modelos.
Participar en el desarrollo y mejora de procesos y herramientas de análisis de datos.
Documentar y presentar resultados de análisis a los stakeholders de manera clara.
Descripción de puesto adicional
Requisitos
Estudiante de último año de grado/máster en Ingeniería / Matemáticas / Física / Estadística / Computer Science, o un campo relacionado. Valorable una especialización en Data Science, Ingeniería de Datos, Big Data e IA, etc.• Nivel alto de inglés (mínimo C1).
Sólido conocimiento de programación en Python y familiaridad con librerias como pandas, matplotlib, scikit-learn y keras.
Dominio en SQL para consultas y manipulación de datos en bases de datos relacionales.
Conocimiento básico de Spark para el procesamiento masivo de datos y de NoSQL para la gestión de bases de datos no relacionales.
Familiaridad con herramientas de análisis de datos como BigQuery sería valorada positivamente.
Experiencia con herramientas de visualización de datos como Tableau o Power BI.
Comprensión básica de conceptos y algoritmos de aprendizaje automático.
Excelentes habilidades analíticas y resolución de problemas, con atención al detalle.
Habilidades de comunicación efectivas, tanto verbales como escritas, para trabajar colaborativamente en un entorno de equipo.
Se valorarían positivamente experiencias previas en prácticas relacionadas con la gestión y el análisis de datos.

Show more

Title: Data Scientist (Credit)
Description:
About Revolut

People deserve more from their money. More visibility, more control, more freedom. And since 2015, Revolut has been on a mission to deliver just that. With an arsenal of awesome products that span spending, saving, travel, transfers, investing, exchanging and more, we've helped 45+ million customers get more from their money. And we're not done yet.

As we continue our lightning-fast growth,‌ two things are essential to continuing our success: our people and our culture. We've been officially certified as a Great Place to Work™ in recognition of our outstanding employee experience! So far, we have 10,000+ people working around the world, from our great offices or remotely, on our mission. And we're looking for more. We want brilliant people that love building great products, love redefining success, and love turning the complexity of a chaotic world into the simplicity of a beautiful solution.

About The Role

We approach Data Science at Revolut the same way that we approach everything else – with class, logical thinking, and lots of style 😎 Let’s break it down: we take the most complex problems and create tailor-made solutions for our customers 🚀 If you’re thinking the Data team is kept in some sort of a secret den, doomed to never see the impact of their work, don’t worry - that’s not how we do things. They’re some of our best and brightest problem-solvers, deployed to the front lines to work in product teams and deliver rockstar solutions 🤘

We start with deep data analysis to understand our customers, their objectives and any issues they might have. We then use various data points and advanced machine learning algorithms, to come up with the best possible option for each client. We experiment, iterate, and build fully automated solutions, based on algorithms which self-improve with time.

We’re looking for next-level Data Scientists to board our FinTech rocket ship and shape the future of financial services apps. Phew! It’s a big task, but you won’t do it alone. 💪

You’ll be working with the toughest and most gifted professionals in Product, Design, Data Science and Engineering, on impactful projects that’ll make our company move forward ⏩

What You’ll Be Doing


Building models for full Retail Credit lifecycle
Improving existing algorithms and building new Proofs of Concept
Delivering real impact to the product through rigorous data-driven solutions
Researching and then delivering PoCs into data products
Collaborating with product owners, engineers, and data scientists to continually solve complex data problems


What You'll Need


Experience working in a data science team of a credit institution
A Bachelor's/Master's/PhD in STEM (Mathematics, Computer Science, Engineering)
Excellent knowledge of data science tools, including, python coding, SQL and production tools
A deep understanding of probability and statistics fundamentals
A big-picture mindset to correctly diagnose problems, produce research, and discover solutions
Excellent communication and collaboration skills to partner with Product Owners and business heads


Building a global financial super app isn’t enough. Our Revoluters are a priority, and that’s why in 2021 we launched our inaugural D&I Framework, designed to help us thrive and grow everyday. We're not just doing this because it's the right thing to do. We’re doing it because we know that seeking out diverse talent and creating an inclusive workplace is the way to create exceptional, innovative products and services for our customers. That’s why we encourage applications from people with diverse backgrounds and experiences to join this multicultural, hard-working team.

Refer to our <a class="postings-link" href="https://www.revolut.com/legal/data-privacy-for-candidates">Data Privacy Statement for Candidates for details on our data handling practices during your application.

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Do you want to drive the next urban revolution? At Cabify, that’s what we’re doing. We aim to make cities better places to live by improving mobility for the people living in them, connecting riders to drivers at the touch of a button. Maybe one day cities will be places where nobody needs a private car. But we’ve still got a long way to go… want to be part of this journey?

About The Position

You will join Cabify’s Data Science team, a group of highly motivated specialists with access to all data within the organization. The team is involved in all main areas of the company, including vehicle and route management, understanding user experience, pricing, fraud detection, and marketing optimization (see for yourself: exhibit A , exhibit B , exhibit C ) . You will work with state-of-the-art tools and infrastructure to help improve everyday operations in more than 40 cities worldwide. Cabify's Data Science team provides a unique opportunity to not only test and learn but also implement great ideas that will shape the future of our cities.

As a Data Scientist In Our Team, You Will


Develop high-impact data science projects, working closely with other data, engineering, product and business teams.
Participate in the results analysis of real-life experiments, following academy-standard scientific methods and procedures, to demonstrate the impact of the new product features we develop.
Develop new machine-learning models.
Help to convert the team’s technical knowledge into real and tangible business insights that bring value to the company.
Join product development conversations, discussing new features and bringing the data science perspective to everything we build.


What we’re looking for


At least 3 years of professional experience working as a data scientist or equivalent research role.
Strong educational background, e.g Masters in Computer Science, Physics, Engineering, Mathematics, Economics, etc.
Solid foundations in Probability & Statistics.
Experience working with Python for data analysis and data visualization libraries.
Experience with data extraction and processing. Capable of writing complex SQL code.
Ability to work autonomously in an unstructured environment.


Bonus Points


Experience bringing machine learning to production, with all its subtleties: deploying, training, testing, model degradation, model serving, etc.
Experience with state-of-the-art methods in topics like deep learning models, time series analysis, bayesian statistics, causal inference, etc.
Experience with geo data modeling, analysis and visualization.


What’s it like to work at Cabify?

We’re a Company Full Of Happy, Motivated People And We Never Want That To Change. Here Are Some More Reasons Why It Rocks To Be Part Of Our High-performance Team


💶Excellent Salary conditions: Individual Contributor L3 [38-53K€]
🏝️Recharge days! (10 Free Fridays annually)
🌍Our office is located in Madrid.
⌚Flexible work environment & hours.
🙌Regular team events.
🚗Cabify staff free rides.
🚀Personal development programs based on our career paths.
📐Coursera: your own license in Coursera to take as many courses as you wish and continue developing your skills.
🧘‍♀️ iFeel: Free access to the iFeel platform, so you can take care of your emotional well-being through therapy sessions.
💳Flexible compensation plan: Restaurant tickets, transport tickets, healthcare and childcare
🐱A pet room ,so you don’t have to leave your furry friend at home
☕️And last but not least...free coffee and fruit!


Cabify is proud of being an equal opportunity workplace. We celebrate diversity and we are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees regardless of background, gender, religion, orientation, age or ability. Join us!

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Motoreto a four-year-old company provides solutions for the B2B automotive sector. Our newest SaaS platform streamlines stock management and delivers precise market insights to car dealers across Europe.

With consistent monthly growth we now serve over 100 businesses. We re ready to invest further in our product and tech foundations to enhance our offering s quality and extend our market reach.

Tasks


Be our #1 data person taking ownership of all data-related aspects of the app with a proactive impact-focused approach.
Analyze large datasets to identify trends patterns and anomalies related to used vehicle pricing.
Develop and implement models to standardize and predict market information.
Design robust validation steps to evaluate and report the accuracy and effectiveness of the models.
Build and automate data pipelines for efficient data processing and cleaning.
Collaborate with the engineering team to deploy your models into our SaaS platform.
Work with web scraping to improve data collection methods and ensure high-quality data.
Provide insights and recommendations based on data analysis to inform business decisions and strategy.


Requirements

Technical Requirements


We don t care about years of experience or diplomas.
Proven experience in data science and machine learning side projects count )
Strong programming skills in Python (preferred) R or similar languages.
Proficiency in SQL experience with database management is a plus.
Familiarity with web scraping techniques and tools.
Strong knowledge of statistical analysis and machine learning techniques. Natural language processing (NLP) is a plus.
Professional working proficiency in English and Spanish.


Soft Skills


Humble curious and eager to get things done.
Excellent analytical and problem-solving abilities.
Capable of working both independently and collaboratively.


Benefits

Team dynamic


We are a small efficient tech team consisting of a full-stack engineer a front-end developer and a product/design specialist.
Our size allows us to avoid complexities and politics focusing instead on clear communication and mutual respect for each other s opinions and expertise.
We work asynchronously most of the time and operate 100 remotely.
We are committed to steady growth valuing our colleagues and delivering high-quality work without compromising personal lives or mental health.
Most importantly we enjoy working and building things together. We are looking for a colleague who shares our passion for owning the product and continuously improving it.


Our offer


A small team environment with easy communication and plenty of room for making big decisions.
100 remote work and you can work from our offices in Getafe whenever you want.
Flexible working hours.
Continuous learning and professional development opportunities.
A vibrant and inclusive company culture.
Free tickets to C.D. Leganés matches in La Liga.
Free VIP tickets to Atlético de Madrid matches in La Liga.
Salary budget for this role is 22.000-35.000 (gross annual) depending on your experience.


Don t worry if you don t meet every single requirement. If you re passionate about what you do and eager to learn we encourage you to apply! We believe that diverse perspectives and experiences make our team stronger.

Python, R, SQL

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Este es el reto

Persona enfocada a consultoría en el campo de Machine Learning, con ganas de incorporarse al equipo de Data Science & Engineering & Visualization, capaz de liderar soluciones que den respuesta a los problemas de negocio de grandes empresas. Que pueda también llevar las soluciones implementadas a entornos de producción y demostrar su impacto con un business case.

Nuestro equipo de de Data Science & Engineering & Visualization se encarga de entender las necesidades de nuestros clientes, pertenecientes a todo tipo de sectores (Banca, Real Estate, Retail, etc..) y ofrecerles la mejor solución basada en la ciencia e ingeniería de datos. Para ello, el departamento cuenta con especialistas en ambos campos.

Trabajamos en entorno cloud (GCP, AWS, Azure) y usamos las herramientas adecuadas para cada problema en concreto.

¿Qué esperamos de ti?

Funciones


Experiencia traduciendo necesidades de negocio a modelos predictivos, su dimensionamiento y productivización, así como la activación y monitorización de estas predicciones en relación a los OKRs.
Experiencia profesional con modelos matemáticos avanzados basados en técnicas de machine learning, especialmente en modelos predictivos de clasificación (i.e., bagging, boosting) y clusterización (i.e., K-means, Mean Shift).
Tener conocimientos de desarrollo de software, Object Oriented Programing, y manejo avanzado de Python: estructuras de datos y principales librerías (i.e., numpy, pandas, sklearn, Keras, Tensorflow, Pytorch).
Conocimientos de bases de datos relacionales y fuentes no relacionales/NoSQL.
Experiencia en metodología DevOps, contribución a repositorios git, monitorización del código mediante builds (docker) y testing, así como despliegues en entornos de UAT y productivos.
Experiencia en metodología MLOps, paquetización de modelos, módulos de entrenamiento y validación, módulos de inferencia, versionamiento de modelos y monitorización de data shift para el re-entrenamiento.
Nivel alto de inglés.
Pasión e interés por los nuevos descubrimientos de modelos predictivos, pensamiento analítico orientado a cliente, y mucho sentido del humor y ganas de convertirse en cocktelero.


Además, Nos Encantaría Que


Que estés acostumbrado a trabajar con algunos de los siguientes paradigmas: series temporales, NLP, análisis geoespacial, reconocimiento de imágenes, etc.
Que tengas conocimientos sobre técnicas de optimización numérica: gradient descent, quasi-Newton, computación evolutiva, programación lineal, etc.
Que hayas trabajado con soluciones cloud orientadas a Inteligencia Artificail: GCP (Vertex), AWS (Amazon SageMaker), Azure (MLFlow). Y la realización de prototipos/productos web en frameworks ágiles.
Experiencia con entornos Big Data y haber tratado volúmenes de datos que requieran entornos distribuidos (pyspark y Databricks).
Que poseas conocimientos en herramientas de visualización: Tableau, Power BI, Qlik Sense, Shiny, Spotfire, etc.


¿Cómo es la experiencia en The Cocktail? 🚀


Modelo de trabajo basado en la autorresponsabilidad y la autogestión con horario y teletrabajo flexibles.
Buscamos la excelencia/mejora en lo que hacemos, generando un ambiente colaborativo. Nuestra filosofía es 70-20-10 (70% se aprende de la experiencia, 20% de mentores/referentes y 10% de formación reglada).
Podrás disfrutar de 25 días de vacaciones al año repartidos entre verano y Navidad, sobre todo. También te regalamos Nochebuena y Nochevieja.
Paquete de ventajas sociales y posibilidad de retribución flexible.
No tenemos dress code. Ven como quieras a trabajar.
Ser parte de una compañía con alma: tenemos iniciativas de apoyo a la maternidad (una sala de lactancia en la oficina y programas para mamás y papás), la sostenibilidad (políticas zero waste), la igualdad de género y diversidad (iniciativas de visibilización e inclusión del colectivo LGTB+, colaboraciones para disminuir la desigualdad social...).
Descuentos y múltiples ventajas para tu ocio y día a día.


En The Cocktail pretendemos ser un referente en talento y calidad humana, y sólo lo conseguiremos siendo una compañía abierta y diversa, por eso tenemos un Código de Conducta que refleja nuestras expectativas de las personas que participan en la empresa. Ofrecemos un entorno acogedor para todos, independientemente de su identidad o expresión de género, orientación sexual, capacidad, origen, religión, estatus socioeconómico…

Próximos pasos

Si has llegado hasta aquí es porque hemos conseguido llamar tu atención ;)

Apúntate a la oferta y el equipo de People echará un vistazo a tu CV. Si coincide con lo que buscamos, recibirás una llamada para conocernos mejor y te contaremos más sobre The Cocktail y sobre el rol. Nuestros procesos de selección suelen tener dos o tres entrevistas, muy cómodas y distendidas.

¿Te vienes?
Show more
HTML:
Este es el reto

Persona enfocada a consultoría en el campo de Machine Learning, con ganas de incorporarse al equipo de Data Science & Engineering & Visualization, capaz de liderar soluciones que den respuesta a los problemas de negocio de grandes empresas. Que pueda también llevar las soluciones implementadas a entornos de producción y demostrar su impacto con un business case.

Nuestro equipo de de Data Science & Engineering & Visualization se encarga de entender las necesidades de nuestros clientes, pertenecientes a todo tipo de sectores (Banca, Real Estate, Retail, etc..) y ofrecerles la mejor solución basada en la ciencia e ingeniería de datos. Para ello, el departamento cuenta con especialistas en ambos campos.

Trabajamos en entorno cloud (GCP, AWS, Azure) y usamos las herramientas adecuadas para cada problema en concreto.

¿Qué esperamos de ti?

Funciones

  • Experiencia traduciendo necesidades de negocio a modelos predictivos, su dimensionamiento y productivización, así como la activación y monitorización de estas predicciones en relación a los OKRs.
  • Experiencia profesional con modelos matemáticos avanzados basados en técnicas de machine learning, especialmente en modelos predictivos de clasificación (i.e., bagging, boosting) y clusterización (i.e., K-means, Mean Shift).
  • Tener conocimientos de desarrollo de software, Object Oriented Programing, y manejo avanzado de Python: estructuras de datos y principales librerías (i.e., numpy, pandas, sklearn, Keras, Tensorflow, Pytorch).
  • Conocimientos de bases de datos relacionales y fuentes no relacionales/NoSQL.
  • Experiencia en metodología DevOps, contribución a repositorios git, monitorización del código mediante builds (docker) y testing, así como despliegues en entornos de UAT y productivos.
  • Experiencia en metodología MLOps, paquetización de modelos, módulos de entrenamiento y validación, módulos de inferencia, versionamiento de modelos y monitorización de data shift para el re-entrenamiento.
  • Nivel alto de inglés.
  • Pasión e interés por los nuevos descubrimientos de modelos predictivos, pensamiento analítico orientado a cliente, y mucho sentido del humor y ganas de convertirse en cocktelero.

Además, Nos Encantaría Que

  • Que estés acostumbrado a trabajar con algunos de los siguientes paradigmas: series temporales, NLP, análisis geoespacial, reconocimiento de imágenes, etc.
  • Que tengas conocimientos sobre técnicas de optimización numérica: gradient descent, quasi-Newton, computación evolutiva, programación lineal, etc.
  • Que hayas trabajado con soluciones cloud orientadas a Inteligencia Artificail: GCP (Vertex), AWS (Amazon SageMaker), Azure (MLFlow). Y la realización de prototipos/productos web en frameworks ágiles.
  • Experiencia con entornos Big Data y haber tratado volúmenes de datos que requieran entornos distribuidos (pyspark y Databricks).
  • Que poseas conocimientos en herramientas de visualización: Tableau, Power BI, Qlik Sense, Shiny, Spotfire, etc.

¿Cómo es la experiencia en The Cocktail? 🚀

  • Modelo de trabajo basado en la autorresponsabilidad y la autogestión con horario y teletrabajo flexibles.
  • Buscamos la excelencia/mejora en lo que hacemos, generando un ambiente colaborativo. Nuestra filosofía es 70-20-10 (70% se aprende de la experiencia, 20% de mentores/referentes y 10% de formación reglada).
  • Podrás disfrutar de 25 días de vacaciones al año repartidos entre verano y Navidad, sobre todo. También te regalamos Nochebuena y Nochevieja.
  • Paquete de ventajas sociales y posibilidad de retribución flexible.
  • No tenemos dress code. Ven como quieras a trabajar.
  • Ser parte de una compañía con alma: tenemos iniciativas de apoyo a la maternidad (una sala de lactancia en la oficina y programas para mamás y papás), la sostenibilidad (políticas zero waste), la igualdad de género y diversidad (iniciativas de visibilización e inclusión del colectivo LGTB+, colaboraciones para disminuir la desigualdad social...).
  • Descuentos y múltiples ventajas para tu ocio y día a día.

En The Cocktail pretendemos ser un referente en talento y calidad humana, y sólo lo conseguiremos siendo una compañía abierta y diversa, por eso tenemos un Código de Conducta que refleja nuestras expectativas de las personas que participan en la empresa. Ofrecemos un entorno acogedor para todos, independientemente de su identidad o expresión de género, orientación sexual, capacidad, origen, religión, estatus socioeconómico…

Próximos pasos

¿Te vienes?

Title: Data Scientist (Credit)
Description:
About Revolut

People deserve more from their money. More visibility, more control, more freedom. And since 2015, Revolut has been on a mission to deliver just that. With an arsenal of awesome products that span spending, saving, travel, transfers, investing, exchanging and more, we've helped 45+ million customers get more from their money. And we're not done yet.

As we continue our lightning-fast growth,‌ two things are essential to continuing our success: our people and our culture. We've been officially certified as a Great Place to Work™ in recognition of our outstanding employee experience! So far, we have 10,000+ people working around the world, from our great offices or remotely, on our mission. And we're looking for more. We want brilliant people that love building great products, love redefining success, and love turning the complexity of a chaotic world into the simplicity of a beautiful solution.

About The Role

We approach Data Science at Revolut the same way that we approach everything else – with class, logical thinking, and lots of style 😎 Let’s break it down: we take the most complex problems and create tailor-made solutions for our customers 🚀 If you’re thinking the Data team is kept in some sort of a secret den, doomed to never see the impact of their work, don’t worry - that’s not how we do things. They’re some of our best and brightest problem-solvers, deployed to the front lines to work in product teams and deliver rockstar solutions 🤘

We start with deep data analysis to understand our customers, their objectives and any issues they might have. We then use various data points and advanced machine learning algorithms, to come up with the best possible option for each client. We experiment, iterate, and build fully automated solutions, based on algorithms which self-improve with time.

We’re looking for next-level Data Scientists to board our FinTech rocket ship and shape the future of financial services apps. Phew! It’s a big task, but you won’t do it alone. 💪

You’ll be working with the toughest and most gifted professionals in Product, Design, Data Science and Engineering, on impactful projects that’ll make our company move forward ⏩

What You’ll Be Doing


Building models for full Retail Credit lifecycle
Improving existing algorithms and building new Proofs of Concept
Delivering real impact to the product through rigorous data-driven solutions
Researching and then delivering PoCs into data products
Collaborating with product owners, engineers, and data scientists to continually solve complex data problems


What You'll Need


Experience working in a data science team of a credit institution
A Bachelor's/Master's/PhD in STEM (Mathematics, Computer Science, Engineering)
Excellent knowledge of data science tools, including, python coding, SQL and production tools
A deep understanding of probability and statistics fundamentals
A big-picture mindset to correctly diagnose problems, produce research, and discover solutions
Excellent communication and collaboration skills to partner with Product Owners and business heads


Building a global financial super app isn’t enough. Our Revoluters are a priority, and that’s why in 2021 we launched our inaugural D&I Framework, designed to help us thrive and grow everyday. We're not just doing this because it's the right thing to do. We’re doing it because we know that seeking out diverse talent and creating an inclusive workplace is the way to create exceptional, innovative products and services for our customers. That’s why we encourage applications from people with diverse backgrounds and experiences to join this multicultural, hard-working team.

Refer to our <a class="postings-link" href="https://www.revolut.com/legal/data-privacy-for-candidates">Data Privacy Statement for Candidates for details on our data handling practices during your application.

Title: Data, AI & BI - Data Scientist
Description:
Resumen

En Prodware nos encontramos en un periodo de fuerte crecimiento 🚀 y estamos buscando gente como tú para que formes parte de nuestro equipo de especialistas.

Prodware España es el partner tecnológico de referencia para la implantación de soluciones basadas en Microsoft Dynamics 365, F&O, PP, CE, BC, O365, Power BI... en el mercado español. Con más de 20 años de experiencia ofreciendo a nuestros clientes servicios de consultoría tecnológica contamos con la plantilla de especialistas más consolidada de España.

Como parte de este crecimiento de Prodware España estamos buscando incorporar a nuesto departamento de Data, AI & BI un/a Data Scientist ubicado/a en España, que combine pasión por la tecnología, audacia y confianza.

¿Qué te ofrecemos?

🚀 Plan de Carreras para potenciar tu talento y crecer en Prodware. ¡Tendrás acceso a certificaciones de Microsoft!

📚 Programa de formación y aprendizaje continuos.

💻 Posibilidad de trabajar de forma remota.

🕓 Flexibilidad horaria.

📅 ¡Todos los viernes jornada intensiva!

🏝️ ¡Julio y agosto disfrutaras de todas las tardes libres!

💳 Retribución flexible.

🎊 Eventos de empresa. ¡Nos gusta divertirnos!

🎟️ Podrás asistir a eventos organizados por Microsoft.

💝 Buen ambiente de trabajo, abierto e inclusivo.

Tenemos un gran desafío de crecimiento por delante y estamos dispuestos a recorrer ese camino contigo. ¡Somos conscientes que esto no lo conseguiremos sin las personas de nuestro equipo!

¿Te unes a nosotros?

Responsabilidades


Desarrollar y mantener modelos de aprendizaje automático utilizando Azure Machine Learning y otros servicios relacionados.
Diseñar, construir y optimizar pipelines de datos en Azure Data Factory.
Implementar soluciones de análisis de datos en la nube utilizando Azure Synapse Analytics, Azure Databricks, y Azure Data Lake.
Colaborar con equipos multidisciplinarios para comprender los requisitos de negocio y transformar los datos en información procesable.
Realizar análisis exploratorio de datos (EDA) para identificar patrones, anomalías y oportunidades de mejora.
Crear y mantener dashboards y reportes utilizando Power BI para visualizar insights y resultados de modelos.
Participar en la implementación de soluciones de big data y garantizar la integridad y seguridad de los datos.
Optimizar modelos y algoritmos para mejorar el rendimiento y la precisión utilizando técnicas avanzadas de machine learning.
Proporcionar soporte y formación técnica a otros miembros del equipo y partes interesadas sobre el uso de herramientas y plataformas de Azure.



Requisitos


Mínimo de 3-5 años de experiencia en ciencia de datos, análisis de datos o un campo relacionado.



Conocimientos:


Experiencia en el uso de Azure Machine Learning y otros servicios de Azure para la ciencia de datos.
Conocimiento de Azure Data Factory, Azure Synapse Analytics, Azure Databricks y Azure Data Lake.
Habilidad para programar en Python, R, SQL y otros lenguajes de scripting relevantes.
Experiencia en Power BI o herramientas similares de visualización de datos.
Conocimientos sólidos en estadística, algoritmos de machine learning y técnicas de modelado predictivo.



Formación:


Título universitario en Ciencias de la Computación, Ingeniería, Matemáticas, Estadística o un campo relacionado. Se valora positivamente un máster o doctorado.



Idiomas:


Ingles profesional (C1)



Competencias:


Excelentes habilidades analíticas y capacidad para resolver problemas complejos.
Habilidades de comunicación efectiva para presentar resultados técnicos a audiencias no técnicas.
Capacidad para trabajar de manera autónoma y en equipo en un entorno dinámico.
Movilidad para hacer presentación a clientes.

Title: Senior Data Scientist
Description:
At ING we are looking for a Senior Data Scientist







Your role and work environment:




We are looking for a talented and enthusiastic Senior Data Scientist to join our Advanced Analytics Team on the Customer Interactions and Monetization Tribe in Spain.




The responsibility of this team is to develop all type of models and analytical products in the field of Machine Learning and Big Data context for the whole Retail Organization. Our way of working mirrors our eagerness to innovate and the agile methodologies are on our daily basis.




Your key responsibilities:




As a Senior Data Scientist you will:




Positively be expected to take charge of end to end design and delivery of machine learning products across different departments in the bank. Which means all type of AI/ML products such as credit risk decision making models, churn, recommendation systems, NLP, income/expenses estimations, data categorization, clustering and segmentation, pricing, OCR, etc…).

Co-create and assess business with the best predictive solution and work in a cross-functional and international team formed by business colleagues, data analyst, data scientists and engineers.

Ensure the designed product meets business requirements, brings the most to the clients and that it complies with our high coding and development standards.




What are we looking for?




Want to know if this job is made for you? These are some of the qualities that we value the most for this role. And if the shoe fits… don’t hesitate to apply!




We are seeking a passionate and highly skilled Data Scientist used to work near to business, understand the challenges and who proposes solutions proactively, defining the appropriate analytical solution for each challenge.




Our dreamed candidate will be:

A value oriented person
With a degree in mathematics, statistics, computer science or related field.
Demonstrable experience in data analysis, visualization and building predictive models (specially supervised ones).
Strong knowledge of languages such as SQL, Python and distributed computing tools (Spark, Hadoop, Hive, etc.) as well as machine learning libraries.
Used to work with Git for peer review and code repositoring.
Ability to communicate technical findings clearly and comprehensibly even for non-technical audiences.
Teamwork skills and ability to tackle complex challenges.




What do we offer?




The time you spend at work, the challenges you face or the lessons you get are very important, but… What about your personal life? At ING we want your work to fulfill you in every way, and that is why we take care of even the smallest details.




Check out what is waiting for you!




Be flexible my friend.

Our model is all about flexibility and accountability. Keeping both our customers and our colleagues needs in mind, you determine together which days you work at home and which you come to ING MAD to offer your best self. Do your thing.




Restaurant card.

So that thinking about what to have for lunch doesn’t take up your time or your cravings.




Our house will be your home.

In our offices you can find electric mobility solutions, doctor, hairdresser, gym, The Good Service (to help you with your errands) and much more!




Health insurance.

For you and all your family (spouse/partner and children).




Life insurance.

We help you protect what matters most to you.




Flexible remuneration.

In addition, you will enjoy our flexible remuneration model, through a more tax-advantaged way, you will be able to access other services such as nursery, transport card, training aids…




Free company shuttle.

It doesn't matter where you live. We have 6 routes (North, Central, South, A5, A42 and A6) to get you to our ING office in Madrid comfortably.




Banking benefits.

Special loans with more beneficial conditions.

Special mortgage conditions after 6 months working at the bank.

And you can benefit from our pension plan after 1 month with us!




More vitality and more belonging

360º care of the employee (physical, mental, social connection & purpose).

Physiotherapy service on site.

Runners club with your own trainer.

Clinics with professional, world-class athletes.

Gympass service.

Employee Networks: Rainbow Lions (LGBTQI+) & Leonas.

  • Ability to communicate technical findings clearly and comprehensibly even for non-technical audiences.
  • Teamwork skills and ability to tackle complex challenges.


What do we offer?


The time you spend at work, the challenges you face or the lessons you get are very important, but… What about your personal life? At ING we want your work to fulfill you in every way, and that is why we take care of even the smallest details.


Check out what is waiting for you!


Be flexible my friend.

Our model is all about flexibility and accountability. Keeping both our customers and our colleagues needs in mind, you determine together which days you work at home and which you come to ING MAD to offer your best self. Do your thing.


Restaurant card.

So that thinking about what to have for lunch doesn’t take up your time or your cravings.


Our house will be your home.

In our offices you can find electric mobility solutions, doctor, hairdresser, gym, The Good Service (to help you with your errands) and much more!


Health insurance.

For you and all your family (spouse/partner and children).


Life insurance.

We help you protect what matters most to you.


Flexible remuneration.

In addition, you will enjoy our flexible remuneration model, through a more tax-advantaged way, you will be able to access other services such as nursery, transport card, training aids…


Free company shuttle.

It doesn't matter where you live. We have 6 routes (North, Central, South, A5, A42 and A6) to get you to our ING office in Madrid comfortably.


Banking benefits.

Special loans with more beneficial conditions.

Special mortgage conditions after 6 months working at the bank.

And you can benefit from our pension plan after 1 month with us!


More vitality and more belonging

360º care of the employee (physical, mental, social connection & purpose).

Physiotherapy service on site.

Runners club with your own trainer.

Clinics with professional, world-class athletes.

Gympass service.

Employee Networks: Rainbow Lions (LGBTQI+) & Leonas.

Title: Data Science - NLP (I&D)
Description:
¡Hola! Somos CAPGEMINI 😊

Tenemos la gran suerte de trabajar en un sector que lidera la evolución hacia un futuro sostenible e inclusivo. La TECNOLOGÍA. El catalizador de tantas soluciones que necesitamos ahora más que nunca.

Somos 325.000 PERSONAS en todo el mundo unidas por una misma pasión.

No importa dónde estemos, podemos estar en casa, en la oficina, a mil quilómetros de distancia unxs de otrxs, pero somos conscientes de que NUESTRO TRABAJO CUENTA.

No importa en qué momento vital estemos, somos DIVERSOS en edad, género, ascendencia, familia… ¡nos hemos certificado en Diversidad y como empresa ÉTICA más de 9 años seguidos!

No importa si tu fase es de crecimiento, APRENDIENDO y FORMÁNDOTE a todas horas o si necesitas consolidarte y aprecias la FLEXIBILIDAD, la CONCILIACION y los BENEFICIOS fiscales y sociales para compaginar tu vida personal y profesional. Lo que importa es que puedes sentir que estás DONDE DEBES ESTAR para conseguir el futuro que deseas.

Cada proyecto CUENTA. ¿Te apetece sumarte a CAPGEMINI y participar en nuestros proyectos? En este caso, empezarías en el sector Seguros, pero la diversidad de proyectos en sectores diferentes te va a proporcionar gran versatilidad y también la oportunidad de especializarte en alguno en concreto, si es tu deseo.

En cuanto al equipo, vas a poder trabajar con equipos diversos, para cada proyecto se constituye un equipo diferente, de distintas ciudades, por lo que tendrás relación con personas que están más allá de tu centro de trabajo o de tu lugar de residencia. Piensa que también colaboramos con otras sedes de Capgemini a nivel mundial… así que tu red de colegas no tendrá límite!!

Nuestro objetivo es poder brindar a nuestros clientes herramientas que le ayuden a tener éxito y conseguir sus propios objetivos. ¿Cómo? A través de nuestra excelencia en conocimiento y metodología, nuestra expertise y nuestro estilo de relación colaborativa con los clientes.

¿Cuál será tu misión?

Tu misión será liderar, impulsar y desarrollar técnicamente con autonomía iniciativas en el ámbito de la inteligencia artificial y también:

Diseñarás, desarrollarás y realizarás el despliegue de soluciones usando modelos de Machine Learning y Deep Learning.

Gestionarás y manipularás conjuntos de datos: Definición e identificación de variables de aprendizaje, generación de nuevos conjuntos, realización de transformaciones y limpieza.

Definirás procesos de Aprendizaje Automático End-to-End.

Desarrollarás procesos de inferencia en entornos On-premise o Cloud.

Realizarás el mantenimiento de modelos existentes de Aprendizaje Automático.

Liderarás equipos técnicos de proyecto.

Realizarás la mentorización de Data Scientists Junior o en formación.

Participarás en propuestas técnicas a nivel nacional e internacional.




🔍 ¿Qué buscamos?

Para sentirte a gusto en la posición es necesario que aportes Grado en Informática, Matemáticas, Física o Ingenierías similares.

Experiencia profesional significativa en el desarrollo y aplicación de modelos de optimización y simulación para mejorar el proceso de toma de decisiones, así como buenas habilidades relacionadas con el análisis de datos, estadísticas y técnicas computacionales.




Experiencia en proyectos de NLP y conocimientos de LLMs.




• Auténtico entusiasmo por el modelado de procesos de negocio así como de sistemas complejos de ingeniería mediante programación matemática con el objetivo de optimización (planificación y programación) y simulación.

• Experiencia con problemas de programación matemática: LP, MIP, NLP, MINLP, CP así como con modelado de incertidumbre (optimización robusta y estocástica)

• La experiencia con optimización metaheurística (algoritmos genéticos, ACO, inteligencia de enjambre, programación evolutiva, etc.) es una ventaja

• Excelentes habilidades de codificación con python (pyomo, pulp, gurobi, localsolver, etc.). GAMS también es una ventaja

• Comprensión completa de algoritmos de solución de optimización (descenso de gradiente, método de punto interior, simplex, etc.) y solucionadores (CPLEX, CBC, etc.)

• Excelentes habilidades de comunicación y presentación, y capacidad para explicar conceptos complejos.

• Habilidad a nivel profesional en los idiomas español e inglés.

• Las habilidades de análisis comercial y gestión de proyectos serían una ventaja.







🌟 Además, sería genial si tienes:

PhD o Máster en ciencias de computación, ciencia de datos, inteligencia artificial, matemáticas o estadística.




Conocimiento y aplicación de la ciencia de datos en diferentes sectores e industrias: banca, seguros, telco, retail, etc.




¿Qué te espera en esta posición?

Pertenecerás a un departamento global y podrás trabajar de manera colaborativa con ingenieros de diferentes países.
Proyectos CLOUD (AWS, Azure, GCP) y/o enterprise.
Puerta abierta a proyectos internacionales sin necesidad de salir fuera, ya que todos los proyectos se hacen desde España.
Tribus de especialización por tecnología y compañerismo en comunidades.




Valoraremos todas las candidaturas. En Capgemini contamos con una amplísima oferta formativa, presencial, online de Certificaciones, etc. Aunque no tengas el 100% de los conocimientos valorados ¡nos encantará conocerte!




La colaboración es clave en el desarrollo de nuevas ideas, de nuevas soluciones, del crecimiento profesional y personal y por eso para nosotrxs es vital el equipo y el buen clima. Trabajamos y potenciamos nuestras COMUNIDADES dentro de la compañía.




Tenemos un CATALOGO DE MEDIDAS de desarrollo y conciliación muy completo (ayudas familiares, seguros y tickets, días festivos adicionales de tiempo para ti y lxs tuyxs, etc…) ¿Nos vemos y te lo contamos?




Hoy has conocido algo más sobre nosotrxs y nuestro proyecto en crecimiento. Mañana saldrán otros proyectos porque así trabajamos, generando soluciones a medida que se nos necesita ¿Te unes al equipo hoy? 😊







TE QUEREMOS EN EL ÁREA DE Insights & Data 📊 es una línea de negocio global y somos más de 25.000 profesionales y vamos a seguir creciendo 🚀😊.




Conócenos Insights & Data: bit.ly/3mBZoku




¿Te animas a formar parte de Capgemini?




¡Te esperamos!




En Capgemini estamos comprometidos con la diversidad y la inclusión. La diversidad es fuente de innovación e inspiración. Apostamos por profesionales, sin importar etnia, identidad de género, discapacidad, orientación sexual o cualquier otra dimensión de diversidad.

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Desarrolla tus competencias como Data Scientist para un gran proyecto en el sector comercio.




En ALTEN tenemos claro que el éxito de nuestros proyectos se debe a las personas que forman nuestro equipo. Por eso, si tienes experiencia de al menos 3 años como Data Scientist, nos comprometemos a impulsar tu talento, satisfacer tus expectativas laborales y hacerte sentir como en casa. ¿Te unes a nuestro #WelcomeHome? ¡Sigue leyendo!




¿Qué buscamos?

Experiencia de al menos 3 años como Data Scientist.
Experiencia y mucha fluidez con Python y SQL.




¿Qué podemos ofrecerte?

Modalidad híbrida en Madrid (Atocha).
Formar parte de una gran empresa competitiva y en continuo crecimiento.
Integración en un equipo de profesionales altamente cualificado, con un buen clima laboral, innovador y dinámico.
Formación especializada y desarrollo profesional continuo.
Beneficios sociales y plan de compensación flexible.
Retribución competitiva.




¿Quiénes somos?

Somos un equipo. Formamos parte de ALTEN, una multinacional europea especializada en proporcionar servicios de consultoría, tecnología de la información y servicios de ingeniería a las principales compañías del mercado español.




Si te gustan las cifras, te diremos que tenemos una facturación mundial de más de 3.650 millones de euros, contamos con 52.700 profesionales y estamos presentes en más de 30 países.




Además, en ALTEN nos enorgullecemos de ofrecer igualdad de oportunidades con independencia de género, edad, diversidad de capacidades o país de origen. Nuestro compromiso está con el talento y con las personas que lo tienen.




Si crees que eres talento, ¡apúntate!

Title: Data Scientist, AI and Analytics Lead - International Markets
Description:
As a Data Scientist, AI and Analytics Lead for our international markets, you will play a pivotal role in leading the development and implementation of data and AI use cases, leveraging your fluency in multiple programming languages and data analysis tools.

Furthermore, a strong understanding of AI and cloud computing will be crucial as you will be responsible for leveraging cloud-based resources for data storage, processing, and AI model deployment.

You will work closely with cross-functional teams to identify opportunities for leveraging advanced analytics and AI to enhance our products, services, and customer experience

Great communication skills will be essential as you will be required to effectively communicate complex data concepts and insights to diverse stakeholders across multiple regions







Responsibilities

Collaborate with business leaders to identify and deliver AI and data use cases that address critical business challenges and opportunities in international markets.
Work closely with IT and data architecture teams to ensure the effective integration and deployment of AI and data use cases within our operational systems and processes.
Lead in the development and implementation of advanced analytics and AI models, from the first implementation of BI dashboards to innovative AI solutions, to drive business insights and operational efficiency across our international operations.
Communicate findings and insights to diverse stakeholders through compelling visualizations, reports, and presentations, effectively translating complex data concepts into actionable business recommendations.
Support the definition and creation of the required data organization teams in each country, ensuring that the right talent and structure are in place to drive data-driven decision-making and innovation.
Stay abreast of the latest advancements in AI, machine learning, and data science, identifying opportunities to apply emerging technologies to drive business value across diverse international markets.







Job Requirements




Education

A master’s degree in computer science, data science, statistics, mathematics or a related field
Specialization on artificial intelligence techniques and models (Machine Learning, NLP, Predictive Analytics, Generative AI)
Knowledge of cloud computing platforms and services, with experience in leveraging cloud resources for data and AI applications, such as AWS, Azure, or Google Cloud Platform.
Proficiency in English, both spoken and written, to effectively collaborate and communicate with international teams and stakeholders.




Experience

At least 6 years of relevant project experience in successfully launching, planning, and executing data science projects, including statistical analysis, data engineering, and data visualization.
Proven experience in conducting statistical analysis and building models with advanced scripting languages
Experience leading projects that apply Artificial Intelligence and data science to business functions
Specialization in text analytics, image recognition, graph analysis, or other specialized ML techniques, such as deep learning, is preferred




Skills

Leadership and team management skills, with the ability to inspire and mentor data teams, fostering a culture of collaboration, innovation, and continuous improvement
Ability to work in diverse, cross-functional teams in a dynamic business environment
Fluency in programming languages (Python, R), Data Analysis and Visualization Tools (Jupyter Notebook, Tableau, etc..) , SQL, Machine Learning and AI Frameworks(TensorFlow)
Strong understanding of artificial intelligence techniques and models, its potential roles in solving business problems, and the future trajectory of generative AI models
Excellent communication skills, with the ability to effectively communicate complex data concepts and insights to diverse stakeholders, including business leaders, IT teams, and external partners.
Superior presentation skills, including storytelling and other techniques to guide and inspire
We believe that the addition of fluency in multiple programming languages and data analysis tools, along with the need for great communication skills, is crucial for this role, as the ability to effectively analyze data, develop AI models, and communicate insights is essential for driving impactful business outcomes across our international operations.










In AXA we value diversity and we work for equal opportunities and to make that everyone feels respected and included

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Para algunas personas, la tecnología es reto, la innovación es pasión, y la posibilidad de cambiar el mundo es una oportunidad.




Somos Integra, empresa referente en el sector tecnológico. Nuestras bases son el valor de las personas, la innovación y la formación constante.




Actualmente nos encontramos buscando Data Scientist que quiera desarrollar todo su potencial en un equipo plural y cercano.




¿Cuáles serán tus funciones?

Obtención de datos, análisis y procesamiento de datos.
Desarrollo de procesos de extracción, transformación y carga (procesos ETL) y modelado y estructura de datos.
Definición de arquitectura y selección del ecosistema/plataforma de gestión del dato.
Participar en soluciones Business Intelligence, gestionando BBDD transaccionales y programación en Python y RASA.
Participar en el desarrollo de cuadros de mando.




¿En qué perfil pensamos?

1 años de experiencia demostrable en proyectos similares.
Experiencia desarrollando chatbots con RASA.
Capacidad de trabajo en equipo y buenas habilidades comunicativas.
Conocimiento en SQL y Python.




¿Qué podemos ofrecerte?

Contrato Indefinido.
Flexibilidad horaria.
Plan de carrera individualizado.




Si has llegado hasta aquí... ¡Queremos conocerte!
