Title: Golang Software Engineer (all genders) - Lisbon, Portugal
Description:
Your platform for simple access to insurance

simplesurance, founded in 2012 and part of Allianz since 2022, is a pioneering Insurtech leader. Our embedded insurance & service solutions revolutionize and secure customer experiences across diverse industries, including bancassurance, automotive, e-commerce, travel, and cyber.

More than 250 tech professionals from 30+ nations drive the vision to become the global connectivity player, leveraging our B2B & B2C solutions alongside our Customer Facing Platforms and Service Portals - amongst others. Simplesurance operates across multiple locations, with headquarters in Berlin and teams in Munich, Paris, Lisbon, Tokyo, and Mumbai. Together, we are shaping the future of insurance technology on a global scale.

About The Job

We are looking for a Software Engineer to join Jean Assy's Team. Be ready for new challenges, because you'll contribute to cutting-edge projects that shape the future of our company. We are committed to resilience, growth and innovation to challenge the status quo, while having fun doing it, true to our motto: ''Never Stop Playing".

At simplesurance, innovation and technology go hand in hand, working in synergy to drive our company forward. We invite you to explore:


TechShare - Discover the tools we use within our company.
GitHub Repository - Access our open-source projects and contributions.
Integration Overview - Gain insight into our integration solutions.


Stay updated with our latest company news by following us on LinkedIn.

Key Responsibilities


Build a cutting-edge real-time cross-selling platform
Take ownership of the backend that powers multiple user-facing apps, advancing our state-of-the-art gRPC-based microservice architecture
Actively participate in code reviews to ensure that our platform and codebase meet the highest quality standards
Take a proactive role in all aspects of platform design and development, with a strong emphasis on scalability and availability


Bring to the team


Solid experience with gRPC, REST API, and Backend testing
Strong familiarity with Agile methodologies, fostering collaboration, and adaptability
Excellent communication and problem-solving skills
Experience building Go applications with a focus on resilience and uptime
Fluent in business English


Even if you don't check all the boxes, we are happy to receive your CV.

What we offer

At simplesurance, you will get an all-round feel-good package including:


Teleworking subsidy
A hybrid environment that fosters flexibility and work-life balance
Easy and accessible working from abroad policy up to 25 days per year
Health Insurance Assistance
28 vacation days a year for you to take a well-deserved break
Financial growth with Allianz shares guided by our investment policy
Sabbatical Programme: after your first year at simplesurance, you are entitled to take a sabbatical leave of up to 2 months
An attractive Referral Programme
Meet our team at our Lisbon office, conveniently located just a 10-minute walk from the Alvalade subway station
Access to our Learning and Development Programme
Fantastic team events such as our Summer and Winter Parties
Open feedback culture and solution-oriented environment
An amazing and caring team dedicated to growth, improvement, and making a difference!


Curious to know more? - Check out what else we offer here.

For your application

No matter your background, we encourage you to fill out the application and send over your fantastic portfolio. We care about equal opportunities. If you have any questions, our team is here to help, just drop us an email at jobs@simplesurance.de and our superstar Talent Manager, Débora Lima, will take care of your application.

„Never stop playing!"
Show more

Title: Sailpoint Developer Senior
Description:
Alter Solutions Portugal is an IT Consultancy Company, promoter of Digital Transformation, part of the Alter Solutions Group, created in 2006, in Paris.

In 2022, Alter Solutions joined the act digital group, constituting a global community of talent in Technology, with presence in twelve countries: Germany, Belgium, Brazil, Canada, United States of America, Morocco, Spain, France, Luxembourg, Poland, Portugal and Serbia. Also in 2022, we were certified as a Great Place to Work©.

In Portugal, we partner with over 120 clients and a team of over 500 people, working in projects for industries as diverse as banking, insurance, transportation, aviation, energy, and telecom.

Headquarters of the Nearshore IT center, Alter Solutions Portugal has a dedicated team of around 30 specialized professionals, integrated into projects with several internationally renowned clients



Job Description



The Security team is responsible for managing tools, access, identifies and global level of security.

The scope of responsibilities of this team covers Acces management, Vulnerabilities management and global IAM subjects.

In this team the Sailpoint Developer/Configuration specialist is responsible for the setup, the customization and the deployment of the Sailpoint tool, and Identity and access management tool:

Develop new Sailpoint functionalities for security managers
Develop JSON connectors customization to integrate Sailpoint in the gobal Azqore security environment
Integrate Sailpoint built-in connectors
Setup, maintain and manage CI-CID configuration, for Sailpoint deployment
Management of technical databases migration (DB2 to Oracle/SQLServer)
Management of unit tests and integration tests (full management, incl. test proof delivery)
Sailpoint day to day management (when in production mode)

Technical management of Sailpoint run:

Infrastructure
Monitoring
Deployment (versions and fix)


Qualifications


Master’s degree in Business, IT or related field
Ideally Sailpoint certified
5 years of experience in Sailpoint projects
Team management (Tech lead level)
API
API Documentation
IAM basic knowledge
Authentication & Authorisation
Docker
Ansible
JSON
Database SQL level knowledge
Sailpoint
Show more

In 2022, Alter Solutions joined the act digital group, constituting a global community of talent in Technology, with presence in twelve countries: Germany, Belgium, Brazil, Canada, United States of America, Morocco, Spain, France, Luxembourg, Poland, Portugal and Serbia.   • Develop new Sailpoint functionalities for security managers

  • Integrate Sailpoint built-in connectors
  • Setup, maintain and manage CI-CID configuration, for Sailpoint deployment
  • Management of technical databases migration (DB2 to Oracle/SQLServer)

  • Infrastructure
  • Monitoring

  • Sailpoint

Title: Front-End Engineer
Description:
Na Deloitte, oferecemos uma experiência profissional que inspira talentos como o teu a transformar o mundo como o conhecemos e torná-lo mais humano, eficiente e tecnológico. Somos um Tech Hub internacional e estamos à procura dos melhores especialistas em tecnologia para se juntarem à nossa comunidade, para desenvolverem soluções únicas e inovadoras nos mais variados e complexos projetos de transformação, de Portugal para o mundo.

Vamos reforçar a nossa equipa a nossa equipa de System Design & Engineering da Deloitte Technology, com um Front-end Software Engineer.

O teu dia a dia e responsabilidades


Integrar e participar ativamente em projetos de consultoria tecnológica, com possibilidade de coordenação e supervisão operacional de equipas.
Planear, executar e/ou coordenar com autonomia as atividades a realizar na elaboração dos diversos outputs no âmbito de um projeto ou stream de projeto.
Gerir responsavelmente e de acordo com a sua esfera de atuação as relações diárias com o cliente, nacional ou internacional.
Utilizar com experiência adquirida diferentes stacks de tecnologia na área de desenvolvimento web / frontend (programming, version controls, testing, and deployment).
Solucionar problemáticas de Performance, Acessibilidade, Responsividade e Compatibilidade no contexto do desenvolvimento web.



És tu quem procuramos?


Licenciatura/Mestrado e/ou formação profissional nas áreas de Design Multimédia, Engenharia Informática, Engenharia Eletrotécnica e de Computadores e/ou áreas similares;
Anos de experiência: entre 2 a 6 anos em projetos de desenvolvimento;
Desenho funcional e desenvolvimento de aplicações Web na componente da camada de apresentação;
Desenvolver e/ou gerar código markup (HTML4, HTML5), styling (CSS2, CSS3) e scripting (Javascript), de raiz e/ou via templating.
Desenvolver aplicações Web com recurso a pelo menos uma das "frontend UI frameworks": Angular, React, Vue.
Desenvolver aplicações Web com recurso a pelo menos uma das bibliotecas / "superset" de Javascript: jQuery, Typescript.
Desenvolver aplicações Web com recurso a pelo menos um dos "CSS preprocessors": SCSS, Sass, Less.
Experiência em projetos utilizando a metodologia Agile e Scrum, Hybrid Agile e/ou Waterfall, e respectivas ferramentas;
Desenvolvimento de aplicações cloud based e em AWS, Azure o GCP;
Conhecimento da língua Inglesa no domínio falado e escrito;
Capacidade de comunicação, relacionamento interpessoal, espírito crítico e trabalho em equipa;
Disponibilidade para viajar;
Experiência no desenho, implementação e roll-out de sistemas de informação;
Capacidade de adaptação a diferentes contextos.



Desenvolve a tua carreira à tua medida


Um contexto de trabalho diverso e desafiante que permite desenvolvimento e aprendizagem contínuos
Plano personalizado de desenvolvimento e carreira – skills e oportunidades técnicas e funcionais – adequado ao momento, às tuas necessidades e objetivos
Participação em projetos nacionais e internacionais, com dimensão relevante nesta área de especialização Benefícios que potenciam a tua experiência
Iniciativas de bem-estar e flexibilidade que contribuem para o teu sucesso nos vários papéis que desempenhas na vida
Pack de benefícios flexíveis que poderás adequar às tuas necessidades em cada momento: plano de comunicações com 70GB de internet grátis, descontos em telemóveis, ginásios, vestuário, viagens, entre outros
Aconselhamento especializado de âmbito pessoal/psicológico, jurídico/legal e fiscal/financeiro, extensível ao teu agregado familiar A cultura que irás vivenciar
Uma cultura de inovação e excelência que nos torna líderes e percursores de tendências
Uma rede para a vida que te faz estar ligado ao melhor conhecimento ao lado de líderes e especialistas
Celebramos juntos os momentos que importam num ambiente amigável, de respeito, confiança, transparência e informalidade
Comunidades (de desporto e outros interesses) e projetos de responsabilidade social em que poderás participar ativamente



Sobre a Deloitte

Na Deloitte, nunca trabalharás sozinho. Vais integrar os mais variados e desafiantes projetos e fazer parte do nosso Global Solutions Center, onde poderás colaborar de forma integrada com outras equipas da rede global Deloitte. Terás sempre alguém ao teu lado para te inspirar, ajudar e desafiar a expandir os teus horizontes, enquanto exploras soluções tecnológicas diferenciadoras. Aqui, ao encontrares um ambiente dinâmico, colaborativo e humano, terás a oportunidade de desenvolver a tua melhor versão.

Além disso, as nossas equipas em Portugal têm projeção internacional, o que demonstra a nossa forte liderança global em diversas expertises tecnológicas.

Se tens interesse em explorar e desenvolver as tuas competências e fazer parte de equipas que desenvolvem soluções nas tecnologias líderes de mercado, então estás no lugar certo!

Somos mais de 5.500 pessoas em Portugal, das quais mais de 2.600 trabalham em áreas tecnológicas, a partir de escritórios e Digital Studios em Lisboa, Porto, Viseu, Coimbra e Faro e de polos tecnológicos em Braga, Setúbal e Leiria.

Keywords: Sobre a Deloitte; Technology; Consulting; Anos de Experiência


Show more

  • Participação em projetos nacionais e internacionais, com dimensão relevante nesta área de especialização Benefícios que potenciam a tua experiência
  • Iniciativas de bem-estar e flexibilidade que contribuem para o teu sucesso nos vários papéis que desempenhas na vida
  • Pack de benefícios flexíveis que poderás adequar às tuas necessidades em cada momento: plano de comunicações com 70GB de internet grátis, descontos em telemóveis, ginásios, vestuário, viagens, entre outros
  • Aconselhamento especializado de âmbito pessoal/psicológico, jurídico/legal e fiscal/financeiro, extensível ao teu agregado familiar A cultura que irás vivenciar
  • Uma cultura de inovação e excelência que nos torna líderes e percursores de tendências
  • Uma rede para a vida que te faz estar ligado ao melhor conhecimento ao lado de líderes e especialistas
  • Celebramos juntos os momentos que importam num ambiente amigável, de respeito, confiança, transparência e informalidade
  • Comunidades (de desporto e outros interesses) e projetos de responsabilidade social em que poderás participar ativamente


Sobre a Deloitte

Na Deloitte, nunca trabalharás sozinho. Vais integrar os mais variados e desafiantes projetos e fazer parte do nosso Global Solutions Center, onde poderás colaborar de forma integrada com outras equipas da rede global Deloitte. Terás sempre alguém ao teu lado para te inspirar, ajudar e desafiar a expandir os teus horizontes, enquanto exploras soluções tecnológicas diferenciadoras. Aqui, ao encontrares um ambiente dinâmico, colaborativo e humano, terás a oportunidade de desenvolver a tua melhor versão.

Além disso, as nossas equipas em Portugal têm projeção internacional, o que demonstra a nossa forte liderança global em diversas expertises tecnológicas.

Se tens interesse em explorar e desenvolver as tuas competências e fazer parte de equipas que desenvolvem soluções nas tecnologias líderes de mercado, então estás no lugar certo!

Somos mais de 5.500 pessoas em Portugal, das quais mais de 2.600 trabalham em áreas tecnológicas, a partir de escritórios e Digital Studios em Lisboa, Porto, Viseu, Coimbra e Faro e de polos tecnológicos em Braga, Setúbal e Leiria.

Keywords: Sobre a Deloitte; Technology; Consulting; Anos de Experiência

Title: Senior Blockchain Developer
Description:
DERA is a first-mover FinTech startup on a mission to unlock trapped value in closed ecosystems. We help companies to enter digital economies by providing them with the infrastructure to create digital assets.

Our payment currency DERA is built to be the robust and solid backbone that powers all interest-bearing assets across various digital economies.

We are seeking a highly motivated and experienced blockchain engineer to join our team on a part-time basis for the first 3 months.

Key Responsibilities


Build and maintain decentralized applications (DApps) and smart contracts.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to design and implement new features and functionality.
Perform code reviews and ensure code quality and security.
Research and evaluate new blockchain technologies and tools to stay up-to-date with the latest developments.


Qualifications


At least 2 years of experience in blockchain development.
Strong proficiency in Solidity or/and Rust.
Experience with blockchain platforms such as Ethereum, Hyperledger, or Corda.
Understanding of cryptography, consensus algorithms, and distributed systems.
Excellent problem-solving and analytical skills.
Strong communication and collaboration skills.
Ability to work independently and in a team environment.


Benefits

You will find professionalism, flexibility, and new ways of working. Our flat hierarchy environment is created to help employees step up professionally and to grow into their dream job.


0.5% equity in the company (common stock)
Positive and supportive company culture
Possibility for a full-, or part-time employment after completion of the first 3 months (plus relocation package)
Dynamic environment where you’ll get the chance to work directly with executives and gain a broad knowledge base across various business areas
Option to shape the future of DERA and therewith digital economies as a whole
Flexible hours and remote working


Salary will be paid upon joining as a full-time employee

As a key member of our team, you will be compensated with 0.5% equity in the company based on a vesting schedule. This is a unique opportunity to be a part of a rapidly growing company and share in its success. At the end of the 3-month period, there is the possibility to join our team as a full-time member with an above market salary.

If you are ready to take on a challenging and rewarding role, we encourage you to apply.

Title: Sailpoint Developer
Description:
Alter Solutions Portugal is an IT Consultancy Company, promoter of Digital Transformation, part of the Alter Solutions Group, created in 2006, in Paris.

In 2022, Alter Solutions joined the act digital group, constituting a global community of talent in Technology, with presence in twelve countries: Germany, Belgium, Brazil, Canada, United States of America, Morocco, Spain, France, Luxembourg, Poland, Portugal and Serbia. Also in 2022, we were certified as a Great Place to Work©.

In Portugal, we partner with over 120 clients and a team of over 500 people, working in projects for industries as diverse as banking, insurance, transportation, aviation, energy, and telecom.

Headquarters of the Nearshore IT center, Alter Solutions Portugal has a dedicated team of around 30 specialized professionals, integrated into projects with several internationally renowned clients



Job Description



The Security team is responsible for managing tools, access, identifies and global level of security. This team works using specific security and management tools, closely wit IT Domains and clients.

The scope of responsibilities of this team covers Acces management, Vulnerabilities management and global IAM subjects.

In this team the Sail point Developer/Configuration specialist is responsible for the setup, the customization and the deployment of the Sailpoint tool, and Identity and access management tool. Contribute to development of new Sailpoint functionalities for security managers.

Contribute to development of JSON connectors customization to integrate Sailpoint in the gobal security environment.

Contribute to integration of Sailpoint built-in connectors

Contribute to Sailpoint run:

Infrastructure
Monitoring
Deployment (versions and fix)

Sailpoint day to day management (when in production mode)

All these tasks will be performed upon the Senior Sailpoint Developer/Configuration manager.



Qualifications


Master’s degree in Business, IT or related field
Ideally Sailpoint certified
2 years of experience in in Sailpoint projects
Windows Security (Not mandatory)
API JSON
API Documentation
IAM basic knowledge
Authentication & Authorisation concepts
GRC
SAML 2
JSON
Database SQL level knowledge
Sailpoint
Protocols: LDAP

Global knowledge on :

GRC (Governance Risks and Compliance)
JSON generic connector for Sailpoint
SAML2 (not mandatory)
Show more

Title: (Senior) Data Scientists - based in Luxembourg
Description:
The positions are based at our Luxembourg headquarters and require regular office presence. The EIB offers you the opportunity to live and work in a truly international and multi-cultural environment. We also offer relocation support.

The EIB, the European Union's bank, is seeking to recruit for its Group Corporate Services Directorate - Group Digital Office (GCS-GDO) – Data & Information Solutions Department (DIS) - Data Management Division (DM) - Analytics & Reporting Solutions Unit (A&R) at its headquarters in Luxembourg, (Senior) Data Scientists*.

These are full-time positions at grade 5/6 for which the EIB offers a permanent contract.


internal benchmark: (Senior) IT Applications Officer


Purpose

You want to be part of our AI innovation lab to build the future using cutting-edge technologies such as deep learning, natural language processing and computer vision. We are looking for excellent team spirit, proactive attitude, as well as a passion for data…. As a member of our lab, you will have the opportunity to promote the latest advancements in the AI industry and deliver AI-powered solutions across various business domains. You will also work with a diverse and talented team of researchers, engineers and analysts who share the same passion and enthusiasm.

Operating Network

You will report to the Head of Unit and work in close cooperation with other IT units and counterparties from all directorates using AI services and solutions. There will be a lot of interaction with key stakeholders such as software vendors, providers of outsourced services, peer groups, consultants in order to optimise service levels and stay abreast of best practice.

Accountabilities


Establish a governance framework with the user community to ensure an effective use of the AI solutions & services within the organisation. Monitor its applicability’s and propose improvements to maximize value.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to identify business challenges and opportunities where AI solutions can provide strategic value within the banking domain.
Design and conduct experiments to validate model performance, accuracy, and robustness, ensuring the highest quality of AI solutions.
Analyse business specifications, implement and deploy machine learning models and AI algorithms to extract insights, enhance decision-making processes, and automate tasks in accordance with the IT policies.
Collaborate with other IT teams to integrate AI solutions seamlessly into existing IT landscape and processes.
Ensure compliance with regulatory guidelines such AI Act and data security standards while handling sensitive customer information.


Qualifications


University degree (minimum an equivalent to a Bachelor) preferably in Data Science, Computer Science, Information Technology, Physics, Mathematics, Statistics, or related quantitative field
At least 5 years’ of IT professional experience with at least 2 years in building and deploying AI/ML/GenAI solutions
Python programming experience with machine learning libraries such as scikit-learn, XGboost, Keras, Pytorch, Spacy or equivalent
Experience with SQL and NoSQL databases
Experience with implementation NLP and LLM based solutions using models like transformers, GPT 3.5,4 or Langchain or equivalent
Experience in Front-end development with Next.js, React is an advantage
In-depth understanding of machine learning techniques, probabilistic modelling, natural language processing
Knowledge of cloud technologies, such as Microsoft Azure Cloud, AWS or Databricks
Familiarity with banking and financial data structures, as well as an understanding of regulatory requirements and challenges within the industry would be an asset
Good knowledge of project management principles, methods, and practices
Excellent knowledge of English and/or French (*), with a good command of the other. Knowledge of other EU languages would be an advantage.


Competencies

Find out more about EIB core competencies here

(*) Unless stated explicitly as a required qualification, a good command of French is not a pre-requisite for hire. As both English and French are however official working languages of the EIB, proficiency in both languages is a pre-requisite for your future career development. Any language clause in your contract must be fulfilled in order for you to be eligible for a promotion (either via the annual appraisal cycle or via an internal selection process). Proficiency is understood to mean the attainment of level 5 of the Inter Institutional language courses, corresponding to B1.2 of the Common European Framework of Reference for Languages (CEFRL). The Bank offers appropriate training support.

We are an equal opportunities employer, who believes that diversity is good for our people and our business. We encourage all suitably qualified and eligible candidates to apply regardless of their gender identity/expression, age, racial, ethnic and cultural background, religion and beliefs, sexual orientation/identity, disability or neurodiversity.

Applicants with specific needs are encouraged to request reasonable accommodations at any stage during the recruitment process. Please contact the EIB Recruitment team Jobs@eib.org who will ensure that your request is handled.

By applying for this position, you acknowledge the importance of maintaining the security and integrity of the Information of the EIB Group. In case of selection for the position you agree to comply with all measures (policies, controls, document classification and management) implemented by the EIB Group to prevent unauthorised disclosure of any information or any damage to the EIB Group reputation.

Deadline for applications: This is an open campaign to consecutively fill open positions. The campaign will remain open until position is filled. Applications will be reviewed in order of receipt.


Show more

Title: Senior Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
Building with the latest tools, our Machine Learning teams launch for Silicon Valley startups and Life Science giants alike.

Join Loka to work remotely, ship projects you're proud of and enjoy every other Friday off.

The Role


Understand business objectives and develop models that help achieve them, plus metrics to track their progress.
Design and implement complex ML systems using classical ML, DL and Foundation Models and following best practices.
Lead client communications by gathering requirements, managing expectations and communicating deliverables.
Wrangle, explore and visualize data with a careful eye for issues that require data cleaning as well as differences in data distribution that may affect performance after deployment.
Analyze model errors; design strategies to overcome them.
Deploy, maintain and upgrade ML models and pipelines.
Follow Loka's career track for growth by demonstrating technical excellence, innovation, autonomy, ownership, communication and teamwork.


The Benefits


Every other Friday off (26 extra days off a year!)
LokaLabs incubator
Explore and Relocation programs (three months work abroad or full international relo)
Remote and flexible
Paid sick days and local holidays
Fitness subscription


The Required Hard Skills


4+ years of ML engineering experience
Bachelor's degree in Computer Science or related
Proficient in English
Experience with Python, ML libraries and AI/ML frameworks (PyTorch, HuggingFace, TensorFlow, Keras, Scikit-learn, Spark etc.)
Strong understanding of statistical, ML and deep learning algorithms (candidates with NLP experience preferred)
Experience building GenAI solutions including prompt engineering (e.g: Langchain), fine-tuning and serving LLMs, search and embeddings, etc.
Experience with MLOps, preferably in AWS (e.g: Sagemaker), as well as standards tools (e.g. MLFlow)
Experience visualizing and manipulating big datasets
Client-facing experience
Clean criminal record


The Required Soft Skills


Curiosity—Ambition to learn and grow into different industries with a modern tech stack
Autonomy and positivity—We're a fully remote, globally distributed team
Teamwork—Enjoy a collaborative approach
Adaptability—Operate with a startup mindset and move at a startup pace


Please submit your CV in English.

Title: Python Developer
Description:
Queremos fazer diferente com o essencial.

Apostamos numa estratégia de corporativismo sustentável. Acreditamos que o sucesso se baseia na construção de uma equipa centrada no bem-estar coletivo, no desenvolvimento pessoal e profissional, e assente numa filosofia de trabalho que potencie a gestão saudável das nossas vidas. Work-life balance, beginner’s mind e community involvement são a nossa identidade, os nossos fundamentos e a nossa cultura.

O que precisas para te juntares a nós:


Experiência mínima de 3 anos em desenvolvimento com Python;
Experiência com Kubernetes e Containers;
Nível C1 de Português;
> Notas importantes:



Projeto remote em Portugal

O que temos para te oferecer:


Gestão de Talento personalizada. Valorizamos e privilegiamos um acompanhamento próximo e regular, somos uma equipa desde o primeiro dia.
Pacote de benefícios amplo e flexível. Seguro de saúde, seguro de vida e acidentes pessoais, descontos e benefícios, plano de telecomunicações e muito mais.
Apostamos na formação e na tua carreira. Formação certificada, plataformas de formação online, centro de exames Pearson VUE... Apostamos em ti!
Sustentabilidade e envolvimento comunitário. Queremos dar significado ao nosso trabalho e investir num projeto de consultoria inclusivo. Para isso, precisamos da tua ajuda.



team.it, back to basics!

Juntas-te a nós?

Na Team IT defendemos a igualdade e valorizamos a diversidade.

Criamos um ambiente seguro, diversificado e onde as oportunidades são iguais para todos!

Não discriminamos com base em idade, etnia, orientação sexual, género, deficiência ou qualquer fator que não seja o mérito.

Todas as candidaturas com competências para o cargo são bem-vindas!

Title: Lead Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
A career in our Technology Consulting practice, will provide you with the opportunity to help clients seize essential advantages by working alongside business leaders to solve their toughest problems and capture their greatest opportunities.

As a Lead Machine Learning Engineer, you will work as part of a team of problem solvers, helping to solve complex business issues from strategy to execution. PwC Professional skills and responsibilities for this management level include but are not limited to:

Co-designing AI solutions with clients
Selecting and training junior team members
Supporting the team with a hands-on approach.

Preferred skills:

More than 6 years of professional experience in developing and implementing ML models
Proficiency in Python and SQL
Experience with ML/DL/Gen-AI libraries (e.g., scikit-learn, Keras, OpenAI)
Expertise in ML Ops
Ability to oversee multiple projects simultaneously
Willingness to collaborate in strategic planning and commercial initiatives
Fluent in both written and spoken English and Portuguese
BSc or MSc in Computer Science, in Engineering, Mathematics or similar is preferred.

We believe you have what it takes. Are you ready to join our “community of solvers”?

Be a part of The New Equation.

Show more

  • BSc or MSc in Computer Science, in Engineering, Mathematics or similar is preferred.

We believe you have what it takes. Are you ready to join our “community of solvers”?

Be a part of The New Equation.

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
hackajob is a matching platform partnering with Tripadvisor helping them to hire the best talent and build the future. To get the chance to get matched to this role and other similar roles, click on Apply to set up your free profile.




TripAdvisor, Inc. is an American online travel company that operates a website and mobile app with user-generated content and a comparison shopping website. It also offers online hotel reservations and bookings for transportation, lodging, travel experiences, and restaurants. Travellers across the globe use the Tripadvisor site and app to discover where to stay, what to do and where to eat based on guidance from those who have been there before. Their workplace is for everyone, as is their people powered platform. Tripadvisor is seeking people that bring their unique identities, abilities, and experiences, so they can collectively revolutionize travel and together find the good out there.




They believe that they are better together, and at Tripadvisor they welcome you for who you are. Their workplace is for everyone, as is their people powered platform. At Tripadvisor, they want you to bring your unique identities, abilities, and experiences, so they can collectively revolutionize travel and together find the good out there.




Tripadvisor is looking for an exceptional scientist to join their Machine Learning Team, focusing primarily on the Tripadvisor Experiences business. Their Experiences vertical provides customers with a collection of over 300K bookable products - experiences like glacier hikes in Alaska, guided walking tours in Lisbon, swimming with pigs in the Bahamas, and many, many more. The fast-growing user and product spaces pose a significant challenge for us: how to match users with experiences that are relevant to them, particularly in international markets where they hope to grow their footprint even further. As a Machine Learning Scientist working in this space, you will have the opportunity to apply your modeling and engineering skills to a number of different areas, but with a particular focus on sort and recommendations. You will have access to the newest development tools and huge data sets. You will deploy your solutions online and be able to observe the impact of your work in real time as you help the company grow.




They are looking for someone who is independent, curious, and motivated; who likes discussing ideas and will bring something new to the table. You will be working in a diverse environment where you’ll collaborate with a broad multidisciplinary team of ML scientists, analysts, software engineers, and product managers. You’ll be encouraged to take ownership of your projects and to find new opportunities and problems where machine learning could be applied to improve the business. Finally, you will also be provided the environment to grow technically and personally into a leader while contributing to the team.




About Machine Learning at Tripadvisor:




Tripadvisor is the web's leading travel information site. At Tripadvisor, the ML Team creates high impact systems that influence the travel decisions of millions of people per day. They apply cutting edge machine learning techniques to a wide variety of areas, including recommenders, online advertising, vision, text processing, and natural language processing. To ensure continued success, Tripadvisor promotes a culture of personal development, including social activities, journal clubs, memberships in online learning resources, and participation in industry conferences. Have a great time while shaping the future of travel!




What you will do:




Participating in the design of machine learning models to solve a variety of core business problems across the Experiences business.
Seek out new opportunities to apply data science and machine learning in the Experiences space.
Prototype, evaluate, deploy and maintain new models in production
Design AB tests and analyze their results
Discover new ways to analyze and interpret the data
Communicate progress and interpretation of experimental results to technical and business stakeholders
Participate in the determination of next steps for each project




Skills & Experience:




PhD or Masters in Computer Science, Engineering, Statistics, or related field preferred
For Masters candidates, 2+ years of relevant, practical experience
Strong foundation in machine learning and statistics
Proficiency in Python for numerical/statistical programming (our group relies heavily on Numpy/Pandas/Scikit-learn)
Ability to interpret and write complex SQL queries
Experience with big data technologies, such as Hive and Spark
Experience with the deployment and maintenance of models - tools like Kubernetes, MLflow, AWS, etc
Show more

Title: Python Developer
HTML:
A Job? Or a Lifetime Experience? Start Yours Here!


We are a Portuguese technology consulting company with a strong outward look to the rest of Europe. We have 10 years of experience in the market and reached the status of “large company” in 2018. We now have more than 350 associates and we keep growing, with offices in Lisbon, Porto, and Leiria, as well as projects in more than 20 countries. Our company is part of the national top 10, with a growth of 250% in the last years.


Work-life balance is part of our DNA. We focus on win-win-win relationships, defining every moment of interaction as an experience with unique conditions. Working with Affinity is a “Lifetime Experience” where you will have the opportunity to demonstrate all your potential and to be successful on every level.


#welcometoyourfuture


What you need to have/know:


  • Previous experience in the insurance industry or insurance related data science projects.
  • Experience with version control system and collaborative development workflows.
  • Strong communication skill with the ability to convey complex technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders.
  • Agile experience.
  • Demonstrated ability to rewrite and optimize code for performance in cloud environments.
  • Proven analytical and organizational skills.
  • Ability to understand business needs and translate them into IT requirements.
  • Proficiency in English


What we expect from you:


  • Will to exceed expectations (your own and the ones defined by Affinity);
  • Exceptional skills and the will to acquire more;
  • Good people skills (not just in terms of technology, language, and platforms), team spirit, and pleasant disposition;
  • Autonomy, proactivity, and focus (even under pressure);
  • Obsession for doing things right, and ability to prioritize;
  • Versatility (you can be a fan of BYOD or not);
  • Ability to innovate and evolve in a market in constant mutation.


What will encourage you


  • Being part of a company that has a disruptive action in the technology market;
  • Being part of a technology focused on relationships, simplicity, and efficiency;
  • Accessing a generative career directly proportional to your performance and interest;
  • The real possibility of being part of our company staff.

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
HOW MIGHT YOU DEFY IMAGINATION?

The Amgen Capability Center in Lisbon, Portugal (ACCP) is home to over 300 multi-national and multi-cultural employees, representing a broad range of cross functional capabilities, including Commercial, General and Administrative, Research and Development and more. The ACCP offers rich career growth and development opportunities, regional and global exposure, and the opportunity to LIVE, WIN and THRIVE in one of Europe’s most attractive cities. The ACCP has been ranked as the #1 company in Best Workplaces (https://www.greatplacetowork.pt/) ranking in Portugal for companies between 201-500 employees, by the Great Place to Work Institute.

Our ACCP Office is located at Maleo – Sete Rios, Av. José Malhoa 19, 1070-040 Lisbon, in the vibrant city center of Lisbon.

If you feel like you’re part of something bigger, it’s because you are. At Amgen our shared mission—to serve patients—drives all that we do. It is key to our becoming one of the world’s leading biotechnology companies. We are global collaborators who achieve together—researching, manufacturing, and delivering ever-better products that read over 10 million patients worldwide. It’s time for a career you can be proud of. Join us.

Machine Learning Engineer

LIVE

What You Will Do

Are you passionate about using machine learning to shape the future of healthcare? We are looking for a Machine Learning Engineer to join our dynamic team! The Decision Sciences team at Amgen plays a pivotal role as a strategic partner to Commercial leadership, offering data-backed insights crucial for driving commercial success.

In this role, you will work closely with data scientists to develop and deploy cutting-edge machine learning algorithms by creating scalable frameworks, state-of-the-art tools, and efficient code. You will assist in the design and architecture of machine learning systems, collaborating with cross-functional teams to integrate these solutions into production environments. Your focus will be on ensuring timely delivery and learning new toolsets and coding packages to stay current in the field.

As a Machine Learning Engineer, you will play an active role in the tactical execution of machine learning projects, from ideation and prototyping to deployment and maintenance. You'll stay updated with technological advancements, ensuring our approaches are both innovative and effective. Your technical skills will be crucial in optimizing code for efficiency and scalability, and your ability to communicate complex concepts will help bridge the gap between technical and non-technical stakeholders. With a strong understanding of healthcare data, you will help ensure our solutions are impactful and fit for purpose. Join us in delivering high-impact machine learning projects and be a part of a team that's making a real difference in the world!

Other responsibilities will include:


Execute machine learning models and code, with a keen eye for quality outputs and consistency data.
Work along the entire lifecycle of cD&A machine learning projects, from ideation and prototyping to deployment and maintenance, ensuring timely and successful delivery of high-impact solutions
Assist data scientists in developing and implementing advanced machine learning algorithms by providing robust frameworks, tools, and infrastructure support.
Contribute to the design and architecture of machine learning systems and pipelines, ensuring scalability, robustness, and efficient data processing.
Optimize code for efficiency and scalability, ensuring modularity and maintainability in machine learning projects.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including data scientists, software engineers, and product managers, to integrate machine learning solutions into production environments.
Conduct thorough research and stay current with the latest advancements in machine learning, artificial intelligence, and related technologies to inform and drive innovation within the team.
Assist in data acquisition and preprocessing strategies, working with data engineers to ensure high-quality data for model training and evaluation.
Communicate complex technical concepts and results to non-technical stakeholders, ensuring clear understanding and alignment with business objectives.


WIN

What We Expect Of You

Our ideal candidate is a team player with customer focus. He/she is problem solving and result oriented and has time and process management skills and can compile data.

Proven experience and skills needed:


Master’s degree
OR
Bachelor’s degree and 2 years of machine learning experience.
University Degree in computer science, engineering, mathematics, healthcare or related field.
Fluency in English, both in written and oral communication.


Preferred Requirements:


Deep expertise in Python: Extensive experience in writing efficient, readable, and maintainable Python code for machine learning applications.
Proficiency in PySpark: Strong skills in using PySpark for large-scale data processing and analysis, with the ability to optimize for performance, scalability, and efficiency.
Familiarity with the Machine Learning Lifecycle: In-depth understanding of the end-to-end machine learning lifecycle, from data acquisition and preprocessing to model deployment and monitoring.
Experience with Cloud Platforms: Hands-on experience with major cloud platforms such as AWS, GCP, and Azure, including their machine learning and data services.
Knowledge of Version Control Software: Proficiency with version control systems like Git, ensuring collaborative and streamlined development workflows.
Strong Analytical and Problem-Solving Skills: Ability to tackle complex technical challenges and contribute to innovative solutions.
Attention to detail: Keen eye for detail in coding, model evaluation, and data analysis, ensuring the highest quality and accuracy in all deliverables.
Excellent Communication Skills: Capacity to convey technical concepts to a diverse audience, including non-technical stakeholders.


THRIVE

What You Can Expect Of Us


Vast opportunities to learn, develop, and move up and across our global organization.
Diverse and inclusive community of belonging, where colleagues are empowered to bring ideas to the table, take risks, and act.
Generous Amgen Total Rewards Plan comprising healthcare, finance, wealth and career benefits.
Flexible work arrangements.


APPLY NOW

for a career that defies imagination

In our quest to serve patients above all else, Amgen is the first to imagine, and the last to doubt. Join us.

careers.amgen.com

EQUAL OPPORTUNITY STATEMENT

Amgen is an Equal Opportunity employer and will consider you without regard to your race, colour, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, protected veteran status, or disability status.

We will ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided a reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform essential job functions, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment. Please contact us to request an accommodation.

Title: Senior Data Scientist (m/f/d)
Description:
Create a better #TomorrowWithUs




At Siemens, we believe that technology with purpose has the potential to solve the greatest challenges of our time. With over 300 thousand of the world’s most brilliant minds and the power of a presence in more than 190 countries, we make a truly global impact.




At the Lisbon Tech Hub, we drive change in our businesses and services, from Portugal to the world, in areas such as Cybersecurity, Software Development and Testing, Big Data, Artificial Intelligence, Cloud, and many more.




With around a decade of history, the Lisbon Tech Hub is the home of the new technologists – Dream Builders, Impact Creators & Future Makers.







Are you one of them? Join us!







About Siemens Technology Department

Siemens Technology is the central in-house research unit at Siemens and as such occupies an outstanding position within Siemens' R&D facilities. It acts as a strategic partner to support Siemens’ business units with R&D services, protects the company’s intellectual property, coordinates the collaboration with top universities worldwide, and supports standardization activities in all business units and regions. Through its R&D activities in Germany, USA, Portugal, China, India, Japan, and Eastern Europe, Siemens Technology helps to secure the company’s technological future and strengthen its ambition.







What is your role in this?

This role is an opportunity for a data scientist who is enthusiastic about developing of applications in such areas as satellite and drone images processing, industrial monitoring and analytics, power grids optimization, leak detection in the pipelines, and many others. The business demands new ways of data processing, analysis and visualization, as well as performance optimization and process management based on cutting-edge technologies in web, big data and streaming.




What are the responsibilities?

Participate in development of analytic components in industrial systems for computer vision, condition monitoring, anomaly detection, predictive analytics, forecasting, signal processing
Work with large-scale, versatile and complex real-world data from industrial facilities to produce innovative algorithms and new types of AI/ML models
Explore the untapped potential of big data for design, engineering and analysis tasks
Make fast prototypes, feasibility studies and devise revolutionary approaches to check new ideas
Work jointly with data science and software development teams to create new solutions and products
Advance the state-of-the-art in the field, including generating patents and/or publications in top journals and conferences







We are looking for someone with…

Commercial experience (3+ years) in data mining, machine learning, knowledge discovery, artificial intelligence, signal processing, computer vision and related areas
Proficiency with Python, Poetry and visualization libraries like Bokeh, seaborn
Experience with Linux, Docker
Proficiency in handling and analyzing large data sets
Knowledge of deep learning tools like TensorFlow, PyTorch
Great interest and motivation for applied research
Good command in spoken English

Would be beneficial to have experience with:

MLOps tools such as AirFlow, DVC, ClearML
Product development based on ML/AI algorithms, interaction with software development team
Generative AI technologies
Development pipeline aspects of data collection, organization, and integration
AWS, CVAT
Additional advantage would be:
Degree in mathematics, statistics or related area
Scientific publications
References or proven successful industry experience
Good results in Kaggle or similar contests







What you can expect from us…

A hybrid and flexible working model to promote a better work-life balance, along with a budget for home office support and the opportunity to do 16 hours a year of volunteer work. A health insurance, access to our on-site medical center, and the chance to join sports groups.

In addition, you'll have access to online learning platforms and discounts with our partners. A shuttle bus to commute to the facilities and the possibility of financial support to your studies.







What makes us proud as an employer:

Top Companies to work in Portugal 2023 (by LinkedIn)
World's Best Employer 2023 - 1st place in the Engineering and Production category (by Forbes)
Most attractive company to work in 2023 - 6th place (ranking of Universum)
Company with the best reputation in the Technological/Industrial sector in Portugal 2023 (according to the Merco Empresas study)




Please attach your CV in English.







#Siemens #LXTechHub #TomorrowWithUs







Siemens is committed to creating a diverse environment and is glad to be an equal opportunity employer. We strongly encourage applications from a diverse talent pool!

Show more

Title: Fieldwork Robotics - Data Scientist
Description:
Fieldwork Robotics is currently hiring a Data Scientist to join their amazing team

About The Company

Fieldwork Robotics is a pioneering technology company that develops modular, multi-crop, soft, and adaptive robots designed to operate in non-controllable environments such as agricultural fields. Their innovative solutions focus on delivering advanced technologies to enhance efficiency and productivity in the agriculture sector. Join them in revolutionizing the future of farming with their groundbreaking robotics solutions. The company has recently incorporated a subsidiary in Portugal, and will be establishing a Lisbon team to compliment the R&D HQ based in Cambridge.

About The Role

They are seeking a talented and experienced Data Scientist to join their team and help derive valuable insights from the data generated by their robots.

The successful candidate will be responsible for analyzing vision and software data, developing advanced models, and generating insights to optimize the performance and efficiency of their robotic systems. This role requires a deep understanding of data science techniques and a passion for applying these skills to solve real-world challenges in agriculture.

Responsibilities Include The Following

Data Analysis and Insights:


Analyze large, complex datasets generated by their robots, including vision and software data, to uncover patterns and insights that can drive optimization.
Develop and apply sophisticated statistical models, machine learning algorithms, and data analysis techniques to extract actionable insights.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand data requirements and deliver insights that support the continuous improvement of their robotic systems.


Model Development:


Design and implement advanced models for data analysis, prediction, and optimization of robotic performance.
Utilize state-of-the-art machine learning and deep learning techniques to process and analyze vision data.
Continuously refine and enhance models based on feedback and new data to improve accuracy and reliability.


Data Integration:


Integrate data from various sources, including vision systems, sensor data, and customer- generated data, to create comprehensive datasets for analysis.
Ensure data quality, consistency, and integrity throughout the data lifecycle.


Visualization and Reporting:


Develop and maintain dashboards and visualizations to present complex data and insights in an accessible and actionable manner.
Prepare detailed reports and presentations to communicate findings and recommendations to stakeholders, including senior management and technical teams.


Optimization and Testing:


Conduct experiments and simulations to test hypotheses and validate models.
Provide insights and recommendations for optimizing robotic performance, including speed, accuracy, and efficiency.
Work closely with engineering and software teams to implement and validate improvements based on data-driven insights.


Requirements


Advanced degree (Master's or PhD preferred) in Data Science, Computer Science, Statistics, Applied Mathematics, or a related field.
Proven experience (3+ years) in data science, with a strong track record of analyzing complex datasets and developing advanced models.
Proficiency in programming languages such as Python or R, and experience with data analysis libraries (e.g., Pandas, NumPy) and machine learning frameworks (e.g., TensorFlow, PyTorch).
Experience with computer vision techniques and libraries (e.g., OpenCV) is highly desirable.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to think creatively and develop innovative solutions.
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to clearly articulate complete concepts to both technical and non-technical audiences.
Familiarity with robotics, agriculture, or a related industry is a plus, but not required.
Experience with data visualization tools (e.g., Tableau, Power BI) and SQL for data manipulation and querying.


What They Offer


Competitive salary and benefits package
Opportunity to work with a pioneering technology company.
Career growth prospects within a dynamic and innovative industry.
Flexible working hours and a collaborative work environment.
Profit sharing/share options.
On-site parking.
Company events & social hours.
Casual dress.


Want to know more? Get in touch with us 👇
Show more
HTML:
Fieldwork Robotics is currently hiring a Data Scientist to join their amazing team

About The Company

Fieldwork Robotics is a pioneering technology company that develops modular, multi-crop, soft, and adaptive robots designed to operate in non-controllable environments such as agricultural fields. Their innovative solutions focus on delivering advanced technologies to enhance efficiency and productivity in the agriculture sector. Join them in revolutionizing the future of farming with their groundbreaking robotics solutions. The company has recently incorporated a subsidiary in Portugal, and will be establishing a Lisbon team to compliment the R&D HQ based in Cambridge.

About The Role

They are seeking a talented and experienced Data Scientist to join their team and help derive valuable insights from the data generated by their robots.

The successful candidate will be responsible for analyzing vision and software data, developing advanced models, and generating insights to optimize the performance and efficiency of their robotic systems. This role requires a deep understanding of data science techniques and a passion for applying these skills to solve real-world challenges in agriculture.

Responsibilities Include The Following

Data Analysis and Insights:

  • Analyze large, complex datasets generated by their robots, including vision and software data, to uncover patterns and insights that can drive optimization.
  • Develop and apply sophisticated statistical models, machine learning algorithms, and data analysis techniques to extract actionable insights.
  • Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand data requirements and deliver insights that support the continuous improvement of their robotic systems.

Model Development:

  • Design and implement advanced models for data analysis, prediction, and optimization of robotic performance.
  • Utilize state-of-the-art machine learning and deep learning techniques to process and analyze vision data.
  • Continuously refine and enhance models based on feedback and new data to improve accuracy and reliability.

Data Integration:

  • Integrate data from various sources, including vision systems, sensor data, and customer- generated data, to create comprehensive datasets for analysis.
  • Ensure data quality, consistency, and integrity throughout the data lifecycle.

Visualization and Reporting:

  • Develop and maintain dashboards and visualizations to present complex data and insights in an accessible and actionable manner.
  • Prepare detailed reports and presentations to communicate findings and recommendations to stakeholders, including senior management and technical teams.

Optimization and Testing:

  • Conduct experiments and simulations to test hypotheses and validate models.
  • Provide insights and recommendations for optimizing robotic performance, including speed, accuracy, and efficiency.
  • Work closely with engineering and software teams to implement and validate improvements based on data-driven insights.

Requirements

  • Advanced degree (Master's or PhD preferred) in Data Science, Computer Science, Statistics, Applied Mathematics, or a related field.
  • Proven experience (3+ years) in data science, with a strong track record of analyzing complex datasets and developing advanced models.
  • Proficiency in programming languages such as Python or R, and experience with data analysis libraries (e.g., Pandas, NumPy) and machine learning frameworks (e.g., TensorFlow, PyTorch).
  • Experience with computer vision techniques and libraries (e.g., OpenCV) is highly desirable.
  • Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to think creatively and develop innovative solutions.
  • Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to clearly articulate complete concepts to both technical and non-technical audiences.
  • Familiarity with robotics, agriculture, or a related industry is a plus, but not required.
  • Experience with data visualization tools (e.g., Tableau, Power BI) and SQL for data manipulation and querying.

What They Offer

  • Competitive salary and benefits package
  • Opportunity to work with a pioneering technology company.
  • Career growth prospects within a dynamic and innovative industry.
  • Flexible working hours and a collaborative work environment.
  • Profit sharing/share options.
  • On-site parking.
  • Company events & social hours.
  • Casual dress.

Want to know more? Get in touch with us 👇

Are you motivated to be part of a Global Analytics team that builds large scale Analytical Capabilities supporting end users across the continents?

Work closely with global & regional teams to architect, develop, and maintain advanced reporting and data visualization capabilities on large volumes of data to support analytics and reporting needs across products, markets, and services.

Title: Python Developer (M/F) - Lisboa
Description:
Descrição da Empresa

A Ankix é uma empresa de competências tecnológicas, a atuar no mercado desde 1999, que presta serviços nas áreas de IT Outsourcing e Consultoria / Desenvolvimento à medida. O nosso posicionamento carateriza-se pela qualidade e inovação das soluções que propomos, assim como pela dedicação e orientação para o cliente e suas necessidades. Acreditamos que são as pessoas que fazem as empresas, pelo que apostamos continuamente na nossa equipa e na promoção de uma cultura de integração e partilha!

Descrição da Função

A Ankix é uma empresa especialista em competências tecnológicas que presta serviços nas áreas de IT Outsourcing e Consultoria / Desenvolvimento à medida. O nosso posicionamento carateriza-se pela qualidade e inovação das soluções que propomos, assim como pela dedicação e orientação para os nossos consultores & clientes, bem como suas necessidades. Acreditamos que são as pessoas que fazem as empresas, pelo que apostamos continuamente na nossa equipa e na promoção de uma cultura de integração e partilha! Estamos a recrutar o seguinte perfil: Python Developer (M/F) - Lisboa - Licenciatura em ciências informáticas, tecnologia da informação, área técnica relacionada ou experiência equivalente; - Liderar e gerir o processo de ponta a ponta de migração de ciência de dados bases de código de uma plataforma de Cloud para outra; - Auxiliar e orientar cientistas de dados em todo o mundo na reescrita e otimização seu código Python para o novo ambiente de Cloud; - Fornecer conhecimentos técnicos sobre seguros específicos bibliotecas Numpy, Pandas, Scikit-learn, NLTK, PyTorch, TensorFlow, Plotly, Polares, PySpark, Dask, Statsmodels, LightGBM, XGBoost, CatBoost, Optuna etc., - Colaborar com a equipa multifuncional para entender o requisitos e desafios do projeto de migração; - Desenvolver e implementar as melhores práticas para fluxos de trabalho de ciência de dados e Implantação do modelo; - Experiência anterior no setor de seguros ou dados relacionados a seguros projetos científicos; - Experiência com sistema de controle de versão e desenvolvimento colaborativo fluxos de trabalho; - Experiência em ambientes Agile; - Inglês fluente; O que podes esperar da Ankix: - Estamos ainda em contexto remoto e outros colegas em sistema híbrido, contudo o teu manager dá-te acompanhamento quinzenal; - Almoços individuais de acompanhamento; - Temos plataformas gratuitas de formações - podes tirar as formações que quiseres; - Grupo whatsapp com todos os consultores - grupo de interajuda técnica e partilha de informação - Parcerias com todos os setores de forma a teres descontos (farmácias, faculdades, restaurante, espetáculos, entre outros); - Atribuição de prémio quando referências um colega - Eventos online e presenciais sempre de acordo com a legislação Vem conhecer-nos e depois tiras as tuas conclusões!

Localização


Lisboa, Portugal

Title: Python Developer
Description:
Descrição da Empresa

Com mais de 30 anos de experiência, a Rumos Consulting atua na área da Consultoria em Tecnologias de Informação, entregando soluções nas áreas de Modern Workplace & Apps, Data, Analytics & Artificial Intelligence, Digital Business Automation, Enterprise Service Management, Digital Design Strategy & Marketing, Project Management Office, Workplace Managed Services, IT Outsourcing e Licensing. As parcerias tecnológicas da Rumos Consulting permitem uma entrega de serviços e projetos de forma certificada, seguindo as melhores práticas do mercado.

Descrição da Função

Na sequência do crescimento da nossa equipa recrutamos: Python Developer Funções: - Desenho, construção e manutenção de código Python eficiente, reutilizável e confiável; - Prototipagem de soluções para provar/reprovar rapidamente novos conceitos; - Identificação de bottlenecks e bugs, definindo soluções para esses problemas; - Garantia do melhor desempenho, qualidade e capacidade de resposta possíveis das aplicações; - Fornecimento de aplicativos de forma incremental, a fim a responder aos requisitos do cliente. Perfil: - Licenciatura na área das Tecnologias de Informação ou similar; - Experiência profissional mínima de 2 anos em desenvolvimento Python; - Bons conhecimentos de Database Management SQL Server; - Fluência em Português e Inglês (obrigatório); - Excelente capacidade de análise e atenção ao detalhe; - Excelente capacidade de comunicação e trabalho em equipa; - Sentido de responsabilidade, organização e autonomia. Local: Lisboa ou Porto (regime híbrido) Trabalhar connosco: - Com mais de 30 anos de experiência, a Rumos Consulting conta com uma equipa de profissionais especializados em TI; - Na Rumos Consulting, os consultores integram projetos altamente desafiantes, com base em tecnologia de ponta e nos mais diversos setores de atividade; - Os consultores Rumos Consulting têm acesso a um plano de formação certificada, o que lhes proporciona uma constante atualização de competências técnicas; - A Rumos Consulting, enquanto empregador, dispõe de oportunidades de emprego com base na equidade, integridade e diversidade. Tendo por base estes valores, trabalhamos para que que nenhuma pessoa seja discriminada com base na idade, grau de deficiência, género, estado civil, gravidez e maternidade, raça, crenças ou orientação sexual. Acreditamos nas capacidades de todos, porque temos no nosso ADN espírito de equipa e de entreajuda, empatia e respeito. As candidaturas que reúnam o perfil solicitado serão tratadas logo após a sua receção, ficando as restantes registadas em base de dados para futuras oportunidades. A Rumos Consulting, S.A. é a entidade responsável pelo tratamento dos dados pessoais recolhidos neste processo de candidatura. Pode exercer todos os seus direitos de titular dos dados pessoais diretamente no Portal de Emprego Rumos, utilizando o seu endereço de e-mail de registo ou o que referenciou no seu CV. Caso não tenha a sua password presente poderá recuperá-la para esse endereço de e-mail. Se preferir pode sempre contactar diretamente a Rumos Consulting, S.A. para exercício dos seus direitos de titular de dados.

Localização


Lisboa, Portugal

Title: Senior Data Scientist
Description:
We’re the world’s leading data, insights, and consulting company; we shape the brands of tomorrow by better understanding people everywhere.

Worldpanel provides brands and retailers with a unique, 360-degree understanding of consumer behaviour across the globe. We are shopper-centric, continuously monitoring the purchase and usage behaviour through the largest omnipanel in the world. With unparalleled datasets, pioneering technology and expert analysts, we partner with brands and retailers of all sizes, empowering them to reimagine what’s possible, and change the landscape to create a better, healthier, more sustainable and inclusive world.

Job Details

Why this job is important

Kantar Worldpanel is seeking a Senior Data Scientist to spearhead transformative initiatives through innovative analytical and AI methodologies, striving to elevate the quality and efficiency of our global services.

In this pivotal role, the ideal candidate will act as the right-hand of the Team Lead, steering strategic direction in key areas of Data Science by developing and supervising the development of deep/machine learning models, collaborating with the engineering team to deploy ML algorithms, maintaining production-level code, implementing data engineering for automated solutions, and exploring new ML methods for efficient data analysis.

If you are passionate about pioneering advances in data science, leading strategic initiatives, and contributing to the global impact of our services, apply for a career that’ll be out of the ordinary and join us!

What You’ll Be Doing


Leading and mentoring data scientists in the team, fostering team building and implementing best practices throughout projects.
Develop and supervise sophisticated deep/machine learning models and statistical algorithms, deploying novel solutions and efficiently retrieving data for robust model building.
Work collaboratively with the Data Engineering team, seamlessly deploying and integrating Machine Learning (ML) algorithms to improve overall functionality.
Exhibit coding prowess by developing, commenting, maintaining, and sharing legible and production-level computer code, ensuring transparency and reliability.
Apply sophisticated data engineering techniques to deliver automated solutions, exploring new ML methods for the streamlined analysis of large datasets.
Build compelling data visualizations, meticulously documenting and communicating findings to internal stakeholders in a structured and impactful manner.
Drive the delivery of effective solutions by collaborating with internal stakeholders, solving critical business questions, and providing strategic business recommendations from a Data Science perspective.
Take full responsibility for key projects, consistently raising the performance bar and ensuring the highest standards of excellence.
Identify and harness opportunities for applying data science to improve, optimize, and expand existing solutions.


The Skills & Experience Needed As Senior Data Scientist


Academic background (Bachelor’s, Master’s or PhD Degree) in Computer Science, Data Science, Machine Learning Engineering, Statistics or equivalent fields.
Business proficiency in English (B2 Level Minimum Required).
Minimum of 5-7 years of proven experience in ML Engineering or Data Science roles.
Experience with the end-to-end Data Science cycle: from data collection to model deployment and monitoring.
Strong data exploratory skills – understand how to break down the data, extract insights, and determine utility within a broad range of business questions.
Proven understanding of commonly used ML/Optimization techniques (Classification, Regression, Clustering, Outlier identification) and statistical methodologies (Distributions, Hypothesis testing, Bayesian framework).
Experience of NLP (Natural Language Programming) models such as BERT, GPT-2, ELMo, RoBERT and CNN.
Experience of sentiment analysis would be hugely beneficial
Consolidated professional programming experience programming in Python, as well as with Spark and SQL, coupled with competence in applying prevalent Data Science and Machine Learning libraries (experience with LLM will be advantageous).
Experience working within Agile Frameworks (SCRUM/KANBAN).

What’s In It For You


Flexible hybrid working
Up to 25 days off, plus your birthday off and two days paid for volunteering
Meal card and flexible benefits where you are allocated funds to spend on a variety of benefits such as transport costs, education related and more


We are not able to offer visa sponsorship or assist with relocation support for this role. Please ensure you have the right to work in the country where this role is located before applying.

Country

Portugal

Why join Kantar?

We shape the brands of tomorrow by better understanding people everywhere. By understanding people, we can understand what drives their decisions, actions, and aspirations on a global scale. And by amplifying our in-depth expertise of human understanding alongside ground-breaking technology, we can help brands find concrete insights that will help them succeed in our fast-paced, ever shifting world.

And because we know people, we like to make sure our own people are being looked after as well. Equality of opportunity for everyone is our highest priority and we support our colleagues to work in a way that supports their health and wellbeing. While we encourage teams to spend part of their working week in the office, we understand no one size fits all; our approach is flexible to ensure everybody feels included, accepted, and that we can win together. We’re dedicated to creating an inclusive culture and value the diversity of our people, clients, suppliers and communities, and we encourage applications from all backgrounds and sections of society. Even if you feel like you’re not an exact match, we’d love to receive your application and talk to you about this job or others at Kantar.
Show more

Portugal

Why join Kantar?

We shape the brands of tomorrow by better understanding people everywhere. By understanding people, we can understand what drives their decisions, actions, and aspirations on a global scale. And by amplifying our in-depth expertise of human understanding alongside ground-breaking technology, we can help brands find concrete insights that will help them succeed in our fast-paced, ever shifting world.

And because we know people, we like to make sure our own people are being looked after as well. Equality of opportunity for everyone is our highest priority and we support our colleagues to work in a way that supports their health and wellbeing. While we encourage teams to spend part of their working week in the office, we understand no one size fits all; our approach is flexible to ensure everybody feels included, accepted, and that we can win together. We’re dedicated to creating an inclusive culture and value the diversity of our people, clients, suppliers and communities, and we encourage applications from all backgrounds and sections of society. Even if you feel like you’re not an exact match, we’d love to receive your application and talk to you about this job or others at Kantar.

Title: Python Developer
Description:
We are One Team. We make it happen. We are Unstoppable.

A Babel é uma empresa multinacional que fornece serviços tecnológicos orientados para apoiar grandes empresas dos setores da Administração Pública, Banca, Seguros, Indústria e Telecomunicações no seu processo de Transformação Digital.

Estamos em Portugal, Espanha, Marrocos, Colômbia, Costa Rica, República Dominicana, Estados Unidos, Chile, México e Panamá. Uma parte essencial da missão da Babel é oferecer aos colaboradores uma carreira profissional de longa duração, pois acreditamos no trabalho em equipa, nas pessoas e na sua força quando elas combinam a sua paixão com o seu talento.

Nosso plano estratégico

Na Babel, estamos entusiasmados com o progresso do nosso Plano Marte 2025. O nosso objetivo é atingir um volume de negócios de 300 milhões de euros e alcançar um EBITDA de 36 milhões de euros com uma força de trabalho de 5.000 babelievers em todo o mundo! O trabalho árduo e o empenho da equipa estão a dar frutos e estamos no bom caminho para atingir estes objetivos, o que reflete a solidez e a visão da nossa organização.

Olhando para o futuro, já projetámos o novo plano estratégico Hyperspace 2029, um desafio ainda maior, que promete ser uma viagem emocionante, cheia de oportunidades para crescer e desenvolver-se profissionalmente. Chegar aos 1000 milhões de faturação, um desafio que estamos confiantes que, com a colaboração e o talento dos nossos colaboradores, será mais uma história de sucesso que escreveremos juntos.

Local de Trabalho:

Formato de trabalho:

Hybrid

Função:

Python Developer

O que procuramos:


Licenciatura ou Mestrado em Engenharia Informática, ou similar;
Experiência profissional superior a 4 anos como Python Developer;
Experiência comprovada com Bibliotecas Python, como Numpy e Pandas;
Vasto conhecimento de Programação Orientada a Objetos;
Domínio da língua Inglesa (obrigatório).


#babel

O que oferecemos:

Babel, the great way to achieve the success.

Queres fazer parte de uma equipa em crescimento, empenhada e inovadora que faz história todos os dias? Na Babel, acompanhamos-te no caminho para o sucesso. Acreditamos no talento das pessoas e queremos promovê-lo, oferecendo-te um excelente ambiente de trabalho baseado na colaboração e na solidariedade.

Trabalhar na Babel é muito mais do que trabalhar numa empresa, é juntar-se a uma equipa de pessoas com uma missão partilhada e um modelo de empresa centrado em valores.

Além disso:


Carreira profissional e formação contínua;
Contrato indeterminado;
Remuneração atrativa;
Pacote de vantagens sociais à escolha;
Equilíbrio entre a vida profissional e pessoal;
Sistema de férias inovador;
Participação nos lucros da empresa.


Junta-te a nós!

Descobre todas as vantagens de trabalhar na nossa equipa!

https://www.babelgroup.com/pt

https://www.babelgroup.com/pt/personas/valores-de-babel

Os dados poderão ser comunicados às entidades que integram o GRUPO BABEL com o objetivo de lhe oferecer o emprego adequado ao seu perfil profissional e aos estabelecidos por lei. Poderá aceder, retificar e eliminar os dados, bem como outros direitos que lhe assistem em matéria de proteção de dados através do site data.protection@babelgroup.com. Mais informações sobre a proteção de dados podem ser consultadas na nossa política de privacidade.
