Title: Python Rockstar Developer
Description:
We’re looking for bright Python Rockstar Developers to join our team

 

Critical TechWorks operates at the cutting edge of BMW Group’s technologies. We develop, deliver, and operate the systems that allow BMW to build, sell, and distribute vehicles as well as the in-car systems that create unique sheer driving experiences. We help build the car platform as well as applications like the navigation system, driving assistance, personalization, and entertainment. If you are a bigger fan of mobile development, My BMW app teams is the right fit for you.


Framework Development: Engage in developing frameworks to facilitate integration testing for various communication protocols, ensuring seamless interactions within complex systems.
Automation and Testing: Craft and enhance automation frameworks for comprehensive testing, including hardware, software, and model-in-the-loop scenarios, to ensure robustness and reliability.
Scripting and Configuration: Regularly develop Python scripts for Linux environments, focusing on configuring the integration of a diverse range of tools within the CI/CD pipeline.
Cross-functional Collaboration: Work closely with other teams, including development, testing, and operations, to understand requirements and deliver effective solutions.
Quality and Reliability: Apply rigorous testing and quality assurance practices to maintain high standards in all software components, contributing to the overall reliability of the systems.
Innovative Solutions: Contribute to the development of innovative solutions in areas like framework development for integration testing, enhancing the efficiency and effectiveness of testing processes.

 

This is a Rockstar Developer role, our take on the classic Software Developer.

Standing as the brick-and-mortar of Critical TechWorks, it plays a crucial role in designing, developing, building, testing, deploying, and maintaining our product. You can find out more - and check other Development vacancies - at this link.

Whatever you’re working on, here’s the lowdown on the technical skills you’re likely to have:
Proven experience developing in Python.

Experience developing scripting for Linux.
Experience with other scripting languages (preferably Shell).
Experience with version control tools (preferably Git).
CTW's Daily Toolkit

Apart from great technical skills, our environment is fast-paced and 100% agile, and prioritizes autonomy, teamwork, interaction and resilience. This means our Python Developers must also possess the following:

Embrace agile and its implementation frameworks namely Scrum, to make the most out of all its events and work to keep evolving a high-performing team.
Be available to be a cross-functional team member by using and developing new skills and enabling a fully responsible team able to cover the whole product lifecycle.
Use standard software engineering practices and tools like version control, IDEs, data dashboards, to manage and keep a systematic and organized development process.
Use state of the art DevOps quality practices and tools such as Continuous Integration /Continuous Deployment (CI/CD) pipelines to build, analyse, perform automated testing and deployment processes, to ensure a streamlined and reliable development workflow.
Run and operate developed software inside and outside working hours if needed, to provide high quality software services (extra compensation will be applicable).
Be available to travel abroad for short periods, as required to support all the phases of the product development cycle when needed.
Have excellent English oral and written skills. German communication skills will be a plus.
Who we are

Critical TechWorks seeks a distinct and treasured corporate culture, that is very much our own. This means:

Growth and Innovation: Be a key player in shaping the future of mobility through innovative ideas.
Engineering Excellence: Immerse yourself in an environment valuing engineering process, where we create, innovate, lead, and make a tangible impact.
Autonomy and Collaboration: Thrive in a culture that blends autonomy with teamwork, contributing to groundbreaking developments.
Continuous Learning: Embrace constant skill enhancement in a dynamic workplace, where your contributions impact cutting-edge technology projects.

Join Critical TechWorks on our journey of innovation, excellence, and redefining the future of motion, one product at a time.

 

At Critical Techworks we are creating an inclusive culture that values our people’s different viewpoints and experiences, regardless of sexual orientation, gender identity, age, color, ethnicity, religion, or disability.

Title: Computer Vision Engineer (m/f/d)
HTML:
Reckon is a fast-growing startup that helps retailers and other business areas to provide their customers checkout-free, ‘grab and go’ shopping experiences. Customers can pick what they want and leave without the need to go to a cashier or scan the products.

Reckon’s proprietary technology combines cloud AI algorithms — which are easily and quickly scalable without the need of on-site installations and product recognition — that automatically identifies all products using their core characteristics and sensor combination — achieving higher accuracy in recognition and fraud prevention.

At the moment, Reckon is looking to establish a strong presence in Europe and the Middle East, working with well-known names in the retail world.


Your Role


Our Computer vision engineers collect data to advance the ability of computers to solve problems by making sense of images. They research areas where computers can process data visually and use machine learning and image recognition protocols to create advanced systems for our clients.


Responsibilities


Improving their understanding of how visual recognition systems are used;

Adapting existing technology to make it perform specific tasks;

Reviewing and assessing the output of engineering models to establish which is most effective;

Developing new systems to improve the efficacy of visual technology;

Researching new technological advancements in the field of vision engineering;


Requirements


Academic Master's degree or equivalent academic qualifications in the area of Computer Science or Engineering, or related studies;

Excellent programming skills (Python and C/C++preferred);

Demonstrated Machine Learning background, with relevant hands-on experience in computer vision approaches for anomaly detection in image data;

Experience in programming with widespread MLFrameworks (e.g., Sklearn, TensorFlow, Keras, PyTorch);

Knowledge of productization technologies such as (REST) APIs and Docker containers;

Growth mindset that challenges the status quo and focuses on outside-the-box ideas and solutions;

Title: Developer AI - Akilis
Place: Santa Maria da Feira, Aveiro, Portugal
Description:
Akilis Innovation Powered by Jolera

We are a product and project development company, working in several different areas such as Healthcare, Telecom, Motorsports and Energy, among others. Our development team is in need of a Senior developer to oversee and manage a team of product development professionals, managing day-to-day activities and ensuring team performance.

Job Role

As a Developer, you will collaborate with a team on various projects, contributing to technical decisions, writing code, analyzing data, and participating in the design and implementation of software solutions.

We seek a creative individual who can thrive in a high-pressure environment, meet deadlines, and possess strong analytical skills.

Responsibilities


Design, develop, test, and maintain the frontend and backend components of our software applications.
Review code work for accuracy and functionality.
Analyze code segments regularly for improvements.
Stay updated with industry trends and technological advancements.
Collaborate with designers to create visually appealing, responsive user interfaces that enhance user satisfaction.
Build robust backend systems, including APIs and databases, to support frontend functionality.
Optimize code, assets, and databases for speed and performance, ensuring a seamless user experience.
Ensure that web applications work consistently across various browsers and platforms.
Implement best UI/UX design practices to enhance usability and overall user experience.
Write and maintain unit tests, conduct thorough testing, and troubleshoot issues on both the frontend and backend.
Work closely with other engineers, designers, and team members to deliver integrated and seamless solutions.
Create clear and concise technical documentation for front and backend code and development processes.



Developer Requirements


Minimum of 3 years of professional experience in a similar role.
Bachelor's degree in Information Technology, Computer Science, or a related field.
In-depth knowledge of software development and related technologies.
Proficiency in JavaScript and TypeScript.
Experience with Python and Java.
Strong experience with frontend and backend frameworks such as React, Vue.js, Next.js, and Flask.
Hands-on experience with AI technologies, especially Large Language Models (LLMs), and familiarity with machine learning frameworks like TensorFlow or PyTorch.
Experience with cloud services and CI/CD pipelines.
Familiarity with containerization technologies (e.g., Docker, Kubernetes).
Experience working in an Agile/Scrum environment.
Excellent communication and time management skills.
Proficiency in English, both written and spoken.



What We Offer


A hybrid working model with flexible hours.
Opportunity to work on diverse and challenging projects.
Collaborative and innovative work environment.
Budget for external training and attending conferences.
Opportunities for professional growth and development.
Health insurance.



Every company by Jolera is an equal opportunity employer committed to diversity and inclusion in the workplace.
Show more

  • Write and maintain unit tests, conduct thorough testing, and troubleshoot issues on both the frontend and backend.
  • Work closely with other engineers, designers, and team members to deliver integrated and seamless solutions.
  • Create clear and concise technical documentation for front and backend code and development processes.


Developer Requirements

  • Minimum of 3 years of professional experience in a similar role.
  • Bachelor's degree in Information Technology, Computer Science, or a related field.
  • In-depth knowledge of software development and related technologies.
  • Proficiency in JavaScript and TypeScript.
  • Experience with Python and Java.
  • Strong experience with frontend and backend frameworks such as React, Vue.js, Next.js, and Flask.
  • Hands-on experience with AI technologies, especially Large Language Models (LLMs), and familiarity with machine learning frameworks like TensorFlow or PyTorch.
  • Experience with cloud services and CI/CD pipelines.
  • Familiarity with containerization technologies (e.g., Docker, Kubernetes).
  • Experience working in an Agile/Scrum environment.
  • Excellent communication and time management skills.
  • Proficiency in English, both written and spoken.


What We Offer

  • A hybrid working model with flexible hours.
  • Opportunity to work on diverse and challenging projects.
  • Collaborative and innovative work environment.
  • Budget for external training and attending conferences.
  • Opportunities for professional growth and development.
  • Health insurance.


Every company by Jolera is an equal opportunity employer committed to diversity and inclusion in the workplace.

Title: Junior Backend Developer (Remote)
Description:
Launch your career in backend development with Kreativstorm, a leading management-consulting firm based in Berlin, Germany. Work remotely with our multinational team and build robust server-side applications!

Are you a backend development enthusiast looking to make an impact? Kreativstorm is seeking a Junior Backend Developer to join our talented team. You will work on developing and maintaining backend services, ensuring they are efficient, secure, and scalable. This role offers a fantastic opportunity to grow your skills in backend technologies and work on exciting projects.

Job Overview and Details:


Location: Fully Remote
Position: Full-Time


Requirements

Ideal Candidates:


Pursuing or having a degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or a related field.
Junior backend developers with a strong interest in server-side technologies.
Proficiency in backend programming languages (e.g., Java, Python).
Strong problem-solving and communication skills.


Your Role:


Develop and maintain backend services and APIs.
Collaborate with the frontend team to integrate user-facing elements.
Optimize backend performance and scalability.
Document and present backend solutions.
Troubleshoot and debug server-side issues.


Benefits

Why Join Us? Kreativstorm offers a dynamic and innovative environment. You will work with experienced developers, enhancing your skills and contributing to impactful projects. We value creativity, collaboration, and continuous improvement. Join us to grow your backend development expertise and be part of a team that drives innovation.

Apply now and pave the way for your future in backend development!

Title: Software Engineer - Python and K8s
Description:
Our mission is to reinvent the way companies manage their open source information systems - on public clouds and in their own data centres. To achieve that we are building a new community around Python opscode for open source applications, running on Kubernetes. We want to move all of Canonical and Ubuntu IS onto this new, open source codebase.

We are confident that we can dramatically improve the experience of running complex business operations - and then we can help our customers embrace those new techniques and products. Traditionally, IS is an inward-facing operation. We would like to transform our IS team into an extension of the product engineering capability at Canonical. Our internal workloads are in many cases the same open source workloads that our customers want to operate. This team will productise those workloads for real-time automated operations on Kubernetes.

This role is ideal for software engineers who enjoy Python, have a passion for distributed systems, and an interest in the entire Linux stack - from kernel to networking to virtualization and containers. It is a role that requires rigour in both code and customer interactions. Our engineers are technically astute open source enthusiasts who are excited about cloud computing and are ready to join a global team charged with delivering world class services to our customers.

Strong Python development skills and familiarity with Kubernetes are key requirements of this role. You'll work closely with other teams in Canonical to ensure your products operate reliably, efficiently and scale to production sized workloads for our customers looking to adopt cutting-edge technology. You will participate and be responsible for ensuring sound software architecture and follow best practices in software quality, testing and documentation.

What you'll do


Work in Python to design and deliver open source software operations code
Work across the entire Linux stack, from kernel, networking, storage, to applications
Learn to think rigorously about application and infrastructure reliability
Shape high quality open source monitoring and alerting infrastructure
Simplify open source operations for our customers and open source community
Demonstrate sound engineering design and testing principles in your code
Follow agile software development practices
Coach and develop your colleagues where you have insights
Grow a healthy, collaborative engineering culture in line with company values
Work from home with global travel once or twice a year for up to 2 weeks for events


Who you are


You love technology and working with brilliant people
You have a Bachelor's or equivalent in Computer Science, STEM or similar degree
You are experienced with Linux systems administration, package management, and operations
You have hands-on experience with at least one public cloud
You are familiar with Docker and Kubernetes
You are an experienced Python programmer and enjoy challenging projects
You understand the importance of reliable software and strive to design and code to that expectation
You are organized and want your team to deliver timely, high quality software


About Canonical

Canonical is a growing international software company that works with the open-source community to deliver Ubuntu, "the world's best free software platform". Our mission is to realise the potential of free software in the lives of individuals and organisations. Our services are helping individuals and businesses worldwide to reduce costs, improve efficiency and enhance security with Ubuntu.

We are proud to foster a workplace free from discrimination. Diversity of experience, perspectives, and background create a better work environment and better products. Whatever your identity we will give your application fair consideration.

#Stack

Title: Middle Python Engineer
HTML:
AgileEngine is a top-ranking provider of software solutions to Fortune 500, Global 500, and Future 50 companies. Listed on Inc. 5000 among the fastest-growing US companies, we are always open to talented software, UX, and data experts in the Americas, Europe, and Asia.

If you like a challenging environment where you’re working with the best and are encouraged to learn and experiment daily, there’s no better place — guaranteed! :)

What you will do

  • Develop and Maintain Applications:
  • Enhance our project that focuses on a rule-based system for sending targeted emails to clients;
  • Work on a web application to streamline conversion opportunities for sales representatives;
  • Manage and develop APIs for optimizing job postings;
  • Contribute to a project for sending and tracking various types of communications;
  • Collaborate and Integrate:
  • Integrate various databases (e.g., MySQL, MongoDB) and APIs with our projects;
  • Collaborate with cross-functional teams to define, design, and ship new features;
  • Code Quality and Testing:
  • Write clean, maintainable, and efficient code;
  • Ensure the robustness and reliability of the applications through comprehensive testing and quality assurance processes;
  • Continuous Improvement:
  • Stay updated with the latest industry trends and technologies;
  • Participate in code reviews, provide constructive feedback, and help the team continuously improve.

Must haves

  • 2+ in software development using Python, with experience in web frameworks like Flask;
  • Databases: Familiarity with SQLAlchemy, PyMySQL, and MongoDB;
  • APIs: Experience in building and consuming RESTful APIs;
  • Tools: Familiar with GitLab CI/CD, Docker, Kubernetes, and other deployment tools;
  • Upper-intermediate English level.

Nice to haves

  • Frontend: Experience with React, TypeScript, and other frontend technologies;
  • Testing: Familiar with Pytest, Tox, and other testing frameworks;
  • Cloud: Experience with AWS services like S3, Lambda, and SageMaker.

The benefits of joining us

  • Professional growth

Accelerate your professional journey with mentorship, TechTalks, and personalized growth roadmaps.

  • Competitive compensation

We match your ever-growing skills, talent, and contributions with competitive USD-based compensation and budgets for education, fitness, and team activities.

  • A selection of exciting projects

Join projects with modern solutions development and top-tier clients that include Fortune 500 enterprises and leading product brands.

  • Flextime

Tailor your schedule for an optimal work-life balance, by having the options of working from home and going to the office – whatever makes you the happiest and most productive.

Title: Junior Outsystems Developer
Description:
A YTech é uma startup tecnológica 100% portuguesa, presente no setor das Tecnologias de Informação e Telecomunicações, que oferece soluções de Consultoria, Nearshore e Projetos Turnkey. Foi fundada em 2020 e conta com mais de 80 colaboradores. Trabalhamos lado a lado com os nossos parceiros e contamos com os profissionais altamente especializados na área tecnológica.




Qualificações Obrigatórios:

2 anos ou mais de experiência com Outsystems;
2 anos ou mais de experiência com React;




Qualificações Desejáveis:

Experiência com MuleSoft




A nossa visão consiste em inovar e reinventar através de serviços tecnológicos, promovendo o sucesso de empresas e pessoas.

A nossa missão é conectar clientes a profissionais altamente especializados, e impulsionar negócios.

A nossa cultura é centrada nas pessoas e no seu bem-estar, o que nos permite retenção de talento e promove uma forte ligação cultural.

Title: Python Software Engineer - AI Solutions (m/f/d)
Company: Seven.One Tech Hub - a ProSiebenSat.1 Media SE company
Description:
Introduction Sentence

As a Software Engineer for AI solutions in our Tech Hub in Portugal, you will be at the forefront of innovation at our company. Engage with stakeholders across various business units to integrate artificial intelligence as a pivotal support tool across our entire value chain, spanning from content processing to monetization. In this position, you will be responsible for designing and implementing data-driven applications, overseeing the application development process, and ensuring a seamless integration of the work done by the data scientists in your team into a final product.

Sounds like an exciting and varied setup? Then become part of our team and drive cutting-edge solutions for the ProSiebenSat.1 Media Group.

What You Can Expect In This Role


Drive the translation of research and POC based projects into scalable, maintainable, and observable production ready workflows
Deliver webapp/cloud based microservices from frontend UIs to backend asynchronous ML workflows
Contribute to the development of products that realize the benefits of ML and AI (specifically LLMs) to enhance the way-of-working throughout the company
Take a leading role in the adoption of software engineering best practices within your project team and mentor more junior and non-backend developers in the area of software engineering
Be an integral part of one of our experienced development teams and benefit from personalized support to foster your personal growth


Your Essential Experience And Education


University degree (M.Sc. or Ph.D.) in information technology, computer science or a related technical field
Strong experience with data centered webapp development in python (e.g., SQLAlchemy, Pydantic, Streamlit) using frameworks like FastAPI, Django or Flask
Previous experience with containerization (Docker, Kubernetes) and AWS services such as Lambda, EC2, ECS, CloudFormation and StepFunctions
Quality-driven mindset with an appreciation for the benefits of CI/CD (Gitlab) and the use of tool to facilitate good software engineering practices (e.g., poetry, pre-commits)
Knowledge of design patterns such as Unit of Work, Repository Pattern, Domain Driven Design, Testing Trophy, Onion Architecture
Fluent in English (Portuguese and/ or German language proficiency is a plus)


What's in it for you?


Become a part of a leading media company and help us to create real emotions among our viewers and customers
Join us in our transformation journey as we work to create a world-class technology hub
Benefit from 25 days of vacation per year, a great flexibility and the possibility of mobile working thanks to our hybrid working model
Enjoy an open and diverse company culture with flat hierarchies, as well as a modern and appreciative working environment and no formal dress code
Take advantage of our wide range of training and development opportunities
Join our P7S1 employee networks and get engaged in a topic you are passionate about, e.g., PROUD, Greenteam, fempowerment, language buddies
Make the best of our structured career path to support your personal development and growth
Hang out with the team at our amazing office space at LACS Porto


Closure

We are looking forward to your application!

Apply within 5 minutes via our job portal.

Your profile doesn't fit 100%? No worries, apply anyway! We support your professional & personal development on the job.

At Seven.One Tech Hub, part of ProSiebenSat.1 as the home of popular entertainment/infotainment and a leading entertainment and commerce player in the German-speaking region, we make digital entertainment happen! Reaching millions of viewers and users each day is the basis of our success. We develop first-class products and take our technology to the next level every single day. You are looking for an exciting career opportunity in media and e-com, love to work for different branches and products, and become part of a diverse tech community? Join our newly set-up Tech Hub and become a crucial part of our digital future.

Company Text

Click here to learn more about the ProSiebenSat.1 Group and our diverse portfolio.

As a signatory of the Diversity Charter, ProSiebenSat.1 is committed to a working environment free of prejudice and actively promotes diversity and equal opportunities among employees.

You have a disability and would like to apply? Then you are very welcome.

We know that we are not entirely accessible yet, but we are working on it. Let's talk about how we can eliminate any barrier together and find an individual solution if needed.

Although we refer to one gender in the text, all genders may be implied.

Valorizamos conhecimentos de HTML, CSS, JavaScript, XML, XSL; 5. Domínio das práticas comuns de engenharia de software; 6. Conhecimentos em metodologias Agile; 7. Facilidade de comunicação em Inglês; 8. Boa capacidade de aprendizagem e adaptação.

Title: Software Engineer - Cloud & AI
HTML:
Vortex-CoLab is a growing collaborative laboratory that brings together academia and industry partners in an innovation framework to drive technology transfer in cyber-physical systems and cybersecurity. We are embarking on a journey that brings together cutting-edge research and engineering to create world-class demonstrators and proofs of concepts to drive high levels of software and hardware assurance. To support this journey, we are actively seeking a Software Engineer with a focus on Cloud and AI to join our team.

WHO?

Requirements

VORTEX-CoLab is looking for an exceptional Software Engineer - AI/ML Software Engineer with BSc/MSc degree in Computer Science, Engineering or similar, specializing in AI/ML Software Engineer technologies with a strong emphasis on data analytics and that gathers the following requirements:

  • 4-6 years of professional experience in software development;
  • Experience with at least one major cloud provider's AI/ML platform (e.g., Google Cloud Vertex AI, Microsoft Azure AI/Machine Learning, or AWS SageMaker);
  • Proficiency in AI frameworks such as TensorFlow or PyTorch;
  • Nice to have Experience with the Elastic Stack (Elasticsearch, Logstash, Kibana);
  • Familiarity with CI/CD systems and best practices;
  • Strong problem-solving skills with the ability to be independent preferably with coaching experience, collaborative environment;
  • Experience in Agile methodologies in particular scrum.
  • Excellent communication skills and the ability to articulate technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders;
  • Experience with version control systems, specifically Git.

WHAT?

As an AI/ML Software Engineer at Vortex-CoLab, you will work with a cross-functional team of other researchers and engineers to support R&D projects related to our innovation team in perception activities as well as robotics and advanced simulations.

How You Can Expect To Fill Your Days

  • Implement and integrate cloud-based AI/ML solutions on platforms like Google Cloud Vertex AI, Microsoft Azure AI/Machine Learning, or AWS SageMaker;
  • Design, develop, and maintain AI-driven software solutions using AI frameworks such as TensorFlow or PyTorch;
  • Utilize data ingestion, storage, and analysis tools to manage and analyze large datasets;
  • Work with CI/CD systems to automate and streamline the development process;
  • Perform data fusion from multiple sources to create comprehensive data models and insights;
  • Collaborate with cross-functional teams to ensure seamless integration of software components;
  • Apply Agile methodologies, particularly Scrum, to manage and deliver projects effectively.
  • Continuously learn and adapt to new technologies and domains as required by projects.
  • Coach and mentor junior team members, fostering a collaborative and supportive work environment.
  • Communicate technical concepts effectively to non-technical stakeholders.

WHY?

If your true calling is to work at the forefront of applied R&D, and if you're passionate about prototyping breakthrough technologies with applications, then we should talk. We are looking for candidates with an interest in innovative research and a commitment to developing practical applications.

Vortex-CoLab brings together motivated individuals and active learners who thrive on doing unusual things every day. Together, we tackle technological challenges with both scientific rigor and commercial awareness to deliver high quality prototypes that may transform the use of technology in the real world.

Rewards & Benefits

  • Health insurance for the whole family
  • Flexible working environment
  • Extra days off
  • Training opportunities
  • EU Salary Range: 26.500 EUR – 35.000 EUR (salary range can change if hired in at a different level)

Title: Test Automation Engineer
Description:
Who is Volkswagen Financial Services?

It's been more than 70 years since Volkswagen Financial Services AG financed the first Volkswagen vehicles in Germany in 1949. A lot has changed since then, but our core goal hasn't; ensuring we meet the mobility needs of the people.

Volkswagen Financial Services today operates in 48 markets through its various subsidiaries, shareholdings, and joint ventures. Volkswagen Financial Services is the largest provider of automotive financial services worldwide.




At VWFS Porto, we are proud to foster a gender-equal workplace, where diversity is celebrated, and every individual is provided with equal opportunities to thrive and succeed.




Objectives:

As a member of the VWFS Porto test team, you will be responsible for developing test automation solutions for projects and initiatives ensuring the highest ROI is achieved, as well as maintaining and extending existing automation suites. You will work alongside VWFS test automation engineers as well as 3rd party colleagues both Onsite and Offshore.




In this role you will be responsible for:

Planning, developing, and executing automated test cases
Working with Agile methodologies together with BDD development practices
Monitoring test executions in the CI pipeline
Reporting results to the testing team and stakeholders
Ongoing maintenance of automated regression packs
Participating in root cause analysis activities for defects found
Working with Project teams to ensure any planned changes to functionality are covered by the regression test suite
Assessing impact to new or changes to existing functionality
Review and prioritize requests for automation
Participating in code reviews with other Test Automation Engineers to ensure test scripts meets the coding standards
Collaborating with global teams and 3rd party suppliers
Researching and reviewing tools that can benefit existing ways of working
Advocate for quality within VWFS teams.




Level of decision-making power/authorization:

Allocation of work to test automation engineers both onsite and offshore
Supporting proposals for further automation
Technical decisions on how best to automate
Proposing new tools, methods, processes to improve quality of the Technical Test function.




We believe that the right profile for this job should have / be:

Bachelor or master’s degree in informatics, computer science or comparable
Previous experience in design, development, and execution of automated & manual test scripts
Strong working knowledge with frameworks like Playwright or Selenium
Solid knowledge using OOP languages like C#, Java or JavaScript and IDE’s such as Visual Studio Code
Experience working with BDD (Behaviour Driven Development) technologies (Cucumber, SpecFlow)
Experience in using application lifecycle management tools (JIRA, ALM, Azure devops) and version control systems (GIT)
Previous experience with CI/CD pipelines like Jenkins, ADO pipelines or TeamCity
High degree of initiative, responsibility, assertiveness, and willingness to travel
Positive and team-minded person with effective communication and presentation skills
Speaks & writes English fluently




Nice to have:

ISTQB certifications
API testing skills
Experience in working in an international team/ project team
Knowledge in two or more of the following areas: Wholesale or Retail Financing, Leasing and Fleet Business.




What we Offer:

Long-term contract
Competitive package including private health insurance, life insurance and meal allowance (pay by meal card)
Bonuses and benefits depending on performance
Schooling allowance and Pension Scheme
Incredible and unique annual company events
Opportunity to work on an international project and be part of multicultural and multidisciplinary team
Solid performance evaluation and career management methodologies
Continuous training – technical and behavioral development.

Show more

Title: Appsheet Developer
Description:
The role requires good knowledge and expertise in low-code / no-code development, architecture and best practices.




The AppSheet Developer is responsible for the daily management and execution of all the development and maintaining applications using Google Workspace and AppSheet, as well as providing support to users.




Location: Portugal

Contract: 10 months renewable




What you will do




Develop and maintain applications using Google Workspace and AppSheet
Provide support to users




Work with other developers to create and maintain a cohesive development environment
Stay up-to-date on the latest technologies and trends




Who are we looking for




Bachelor’s degree from in Computer Science, Information Systems, or related field, required
Minimum 2 years of IT industry experience




Experience with Google Workspace and AppSheet
Strong understanding of programming languages such as Python and JavaScript




Experience with Agile development methodologies
Excellent communication and teamwork skills




Relevant IT experience in Digital solutions (No-Code / Low-Code)
Strong verbal and written communication skills

menna.chikhi@lafosse.com

Title: Middle/Senior Python Developer
Description:
Devexperts has been working for nearly two decades consulting and developing for the financial industry. We solve complex technological challenges facing the most well-respected financial institutions worldwide.

By becoming a part of Devexperts, you’ll become a part of a company that fosters self-improvement and actively seeks out-of-the-box ideas. Our teams work together to create the next generation of financial software solutions. We welcome all candidates who believe, as we do, that innovation is grounded in education.

Job Description

We are looking for a Middle/Senior Python Developerto join the project for a Top-5 US retail broker (by the number of users). The project is devoted to trading experience, finance reports, and risk management.

You will join cross-functional team that excels in getting features done from zero to production.

Key Responsibilities:

• Design and develop robust, scalable, and efficient finance services using Python.

• Implement versatile finance reporting pipelines.

• Implement integrations for internal and external finance services.

• Troubleshoot, debug, and enhance an existing system.

• Research and implement new technologies to maximize development efficiency.

• Collaborate with cross-functional teams (located in the US and Canada) to define, design, and ship new features.

Qualifications

• Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field.

• 4+ years of proven experience as a Python Developer (experience in the FinTech sector is a plus).

• Strong understanding of at least one of these frameworks: Django, Flask, FastAPI.

• Excellent problem-solving skills and ability to work under pressure.

• Substantial communication and teamwork skills.

• Upper-intermediate English.

Knowing these technologies will count as a plus:

• Data engineering technologies (Apache Spark, PySpark, Airflow, and Presto)

• Experience with cloud services (preferably AWS) and containerization technologies (Docker, Kubernetes).

• Experience in live coding sessions during an interview.

Join our team in Porto and enjoy:

Sport compensation
Medical Insurance
Meal cards
Free snacks in the office
Modern well-equipped office in the scientific R&D area
Corporate events and teambuildings
Professional certifications
Internal Referral Program
Internal education and mentorship program
English courses

Title: Engenheiro de Software
HTML:
Como imaginas o futuro?

O nosso propósito é criar um futuro mais inteligente para uma vida melhor.

Contamos contigo para te juntares a nós e ajudares a construir um mundo melhor para as gerações futuras.

Quem somos:

A Efacec é uma empresa com 75 anos de história a inovar pelo mundo que partilhamos, atuando em setores estruturantes para a sociedade e de reconhecida importância em todas as geografias em que está presente, promovendo a mudança e impactando positivamente milhões de pessoas.

Em Portugal, estamos nos polos da Arroteia (sede), Maia e Oeiras, tendo ainda uma pegada global com presença em 13 países e vendas em mais de 86 países.

O que procuramos:

Para reforçar a nossa equipa de Tecnologia da Unidade de Mobilidade Elétrica (Polo da Maia), estamos à procura de um Engenheiro de Software para suportar as atividades de Desenvolvimento de Software de Alto Nível de estações de carregamento de veículos elétricos.

Missão:

  • Projetar, desenvolver e implementar software para sistemas de mobilidade elétrica;
  • Colaborar de forma multidisciplinar para criar soluções de software eficientes e confiáveis, garantindo a integração perfeita entre hardware e software;
  • Realizar análises de requisitos, identificar lacunas e propor soluções técnicas inovadoras para problemas complexos;
  • Participar do ciclo completo de desenvolvimento de software, desde a concepção até a implantação e manutenção contínua.


Perfil:

  • Licenciatura/Mestrado em Engenhara Eletrotécnica/Informática;
  • Mais de 2 anos de experiência no desenvolvimento de software;
  • Conhecimento de implementação software em C++ e/ou Java;
  • Experiencia em desenvolvimento e utilização de Linux;
  • Conhecimento de implementação software Bash e Phyton;
  • Experiência em implementação de drivers comunicação como Modbus;
  • Experiência em desenvolvimento e implementação de stacks protocolares em TCP/IP;
  • Capacidade de trabalhar com objetivos e prazos;
  • Orientação para a equipa;
  • Elevada capacidade de resolução de problemas;
  • Boa capacidade aprendizagem;
  • Capacidade de ter atenção ao detalhe;
  • Boa capacidade de comunicação verbal e escrita;
  • Bons conhecimentos de inglês.


O que oferecemos:

  • Possibilidade de integrar um grupo empresarial de referência com forte presença internacional;
  • Possibilidade de aprendizagem e capacitação num regime de “learning by doing”;
  • Acesso a formação através da nossa Mast3r Academia (Academia de formação interna) e de instituições de ensino;
  • Acesso permanente aos nossos serviços médicos e de enfermagem;
  • Acesso a protocolos e parcerias estratégicas;
  • Possibilidade de trabalhar num regime híbrido (presencial/remoto).

Title: Zoho Developer
HTML:
// Bee motto

if (me.dareToChange() == true) { me.sendCV(); me.happy(true); }


Somos uma consultora de tecnologias de informação com foco em projetos de Engenharia associados às Tecnologias da Informação. Centralizamos aquilo que de melhor fazemos, em 2 modelos de atuação: OTS e DxSpark. Temos uma equipa diversa, de cerca de 200 profissionais, que se movem como um todo para atingir um propósito: o sucesso.


Dare to Have:

Experiência de desenvolvimento em Zoho que garanta a qualidade e cumprimentos de padrões desenvolvimento de software e participe na definição de standards particulares de desenvolvimento.

O que valorizamos:

- Formação académica e experiência em engenharia informática ou similar

- Conhecimento dos produtos Zoho (Creator, CRM, Analitics, Catalyst)

- Conhecimento de Deluge

- Conhecimento de JS pela norma ES6 (Preferência OOP)

- Conhecimento de frameworks de JS (Vue/React)

- Conhecimento de webservices (REST e SOAP)

- Conhecimento de modelagem de arquitectura (UML 2.0)

- Capacidade de análise, documentação

- Capacidade de apoio a equipas

- Capacidade de análise da lógica de negócio

- Domínio do inglês

- Familiaridade com metodologias e ferramentas ágeis

- Fortes habilidades de comunicação

- Capacidade Analítica

- Pensamento crítico


Dare to live:

Global Mindset | integração numa empresa internacional de rápido crescimento;

Continuous Learning | plano de formação e certificação gratuitas em tecnologias, metodologias, línguas e soft-skills;

Infinite Feedback | acompanhamento e progressão de carreira;

Health | Seguro de saúde, dentário e seguro de vida;

Partnerships| benefícios e descontos em restaurantes, ginásios, viagens, farmácias e muito mais;

One to one | valorizamos a comunicação aberta entre todos;

Celebrations| celebramos juntos perto ou longe;

Special Days| dias especiais festejados em conjunto e com prendas especiais;

Referral Program | programa de referência de colegas e amigos;

Stack| portátil, pacote de dados e kit de boas-vindas.

Diversity| Na Bee Engineering defendemos a igualdade e valorizamos a diversidade. Criamos um ambiente seguro, diversificado e onde as oportunidades são iguais para todos os colaboradores. Não discriminamos com base em idade, etnia, orientação sexual, género, deficiência ou qualquer fator que não seja o mérito. Todas as candidaturas com competências para o cargo são bem-vindas.

Title: Software Control Engineer
Description:
Do you get excited about working with a world team in an inspiring work environment?

Vestas Technology & Operations > Research & Development (R&D) > LaC Infrastructure

Through innovation, development, and continuous product improvement we develop the products and technologies that brings the highest possible value to our customers and to Vestas. Loads & Control (LaC) is responsible for designing and optimizing Vestas' products for optimal performance, loads and control strategies together with cross-product design work. The department consists of highly skilled, international, and well experienced engineers located across Portugal, Denmark, and India. In LaC Modelling & Infrastructure you will be taking full responsibility for developing SW solutions to enable simulation models for loads and power predictions which are efficient, scalable and with an adequate physical representation of Vestas WTG and Plant products. We have a sophisticated modelling environment that is closely interfaced with loads and control processes and activities and plays a vital role in overall product development and other value chain activities, as Vestas heavily relies on these to take critical business and product design decisions.

We are seeking a highly skilled and experienced Software Engineer with a polyglot programming background to join our creative team. The ideal candidate will have a strong foundation in Python, MATLAB, and C#, with Delphi experience being a bonus. This role requires a minimum of 5 years of professional experience, and familiarity with the Agile framework is essential. Experience in the wind domain, particularly in loads and control software development, and any cloud environment will be highly advantageous.

Responsibilities

Develop, test, and maintain software applications using Python, MATLAB, C#, and optionally Delphi.
Collaborate with global teams to design, implement, and optimize software solutions.
Work as an individual contributor on complex projects, taking full ownership of the software development lifecycle.
Participate in Agile ceremonies, including sprint planning, daily stand-ups, and retrospectives.
Integrate software solutions with cloud environments and ensure seamless deployment.
Utilize wind domain knowledge, especially in loads and control software development, to enhance application performance and functionality.
Write clean, maintainable, and efficient code while following best practices and coding standards.
Conduct code reviews, provide constructive feedback, and mentor junior engineers.
Troubleshoot, debug, and resolve software defects and issues in a timely manner.
Continuously explore new technologies and frameworks to improve development processes and product quality.

Qualifications

Bachelor's or Master's degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field.
More than 2 years of professional software development experience.
Proficiency in Python, MATLAB, and C#.
Experience with Delphi is advantageous.
Strong understanding and experience with Agile methodologies.
Experience working in the wind domain is an added advantage.
Experience in loads and control software development is highly advantageous.
Familiarity with cloud environments such as AWS, Azure, or Google Cloud Platform.
Advanced problem-solving skills and the ability to work individually and as part of a global team.
Strong communication skills, both verbal and written, with the ability to convey complex technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders.

Competencies

Experience with version control systems such as Git.
Knowledge of software design patterns and principles.
Familiarity with CI/CD pipelines and automated testing frameworks.
Experience in developing and deploying microservices.
Understanding of data structures, algorithms, and performance optimization techniques.

What We Offer

We offer an opportunity to be part of a global team in an exciting business with a very comprehensive product range. The working environment in Loads & Control is informal but with clear direction. You will have the freedom to develop innovative solutions and actively support the department in setting the direction and principles of its digital transformation. You will be offered an attractive compensation package based on your qualifications and the demands of this position.

Additional information

We look forward to receiving your application as soon as possible, as we will be reviewing applications on a rolling basis. To apply for this opportunity please submit your resume in English.

Title: Software Engineer - Front End
Description:
FARFETCH exists for the love of fashion. Our mission is to be the global platform for luxury fashion, connecting creators, curators and consumers.

We're a positive platform for good, bringing together an incredible creative community made up by our people, our partners and our customers. This community is at the heart of our business success. We welcome differences, empower individuality and celebrate diverse skills and perspectives, creating an inclusive environment for everyone. We are FARFETCH for All.

TECHNOLOGY

We're on a mission to build the technology that powers the global platform for luxury fashion. We operate a modular end-to-end technology platform purpose-built to connect the luxury fashion ecosystem worldwide, addressing complex challenges and enjoying it. We're empowered to break traditions and revolutionise, with the freedom and autonomy to make a difference for our customers all over the world.

PORTO

Our Porto office is located in Portugal's vibrant second city, known for its history and its creative yet cosy environment. From Account Management to Technology and Product, whatever your skills are, you'll find your fit here. You can have an informal meeting in the treehouse or play the piano in your lunch break!

THE ROLE

We are looking for a Software Engineer - Front End. You will be working in a very relaxed environment and be part of a well-motivated and growing team. If you love to learn, if you are willing to share knowledge and would love to be part of the building process to reach the top, using the latest technology stack and having fun doing it, this is an opportunity you can't miss.

What You'll Do


Create new solutions for Farfetch on a global scale, consumed by all people within the Farfetch group
Amaze customers by creating personalised experiences crafted with care
Be part of the Front-end community, where we all work together and help each other to create the best experience for our users
Collaborate directly with Design and Product teams to create meaningful and delightful experiences
Work in a modern stack, React-based, with unique challenges and an always evolving environment
Help developing a scalable and sustainable system through all our web products
Contribute to the update and progression of our documentation and guidelines
Contribute to our open-sourced packages, used on all our b2b products.


Who You Are


A professional with 3+ years of experience on Front-End development.
Proficient on the base front-end development technologies including HTML5/CSS3/JavaScript.
Experienced in JavaScript, including concepts like asynchronous programming, closures and ES6
A professional with an understanding of JavaScript design patterns, data structures, and web architecture and how to apply them
Proficient in some of the following: TypeScript, React or Node. Concepts like asynchronous programming, closures, and ES6 are part of your vocabulary.
Someone that's willing to create solutions at scale and with a performance-driven mindset
Experienced in unit testing
Knowledgeable in Git source control
Proficient in written and spoken English.

Title: DevOps Engineer
HTML:
PrimeIT is a leading company with 19 international offices, focused on providing IT, Telecommunications, and Engineering services. We boost our partners’ business, using the most advanced technology and the best professionals in the sector. Our 17 years of experience make us experts on Team Extension, Nearshore, Managed Services and Custom Software. For this, we currently have a team of more than 2350 professionals who collaborate in national and international projects in the most diverse technologies.


LISBOA | PORTO | MADRID | BARCELONA | PARIS | LYON | NANTES | LILLE | AIX-EN-PROVENCE | BORDEAUX | GRENOBLE | TOURS | MILANO | GENÈVE | KATOWICE | WARSZAWA | WROCŁAW | LONDON | SÃO PAULO


We're looking for a DevOps:


✅Min. 7 years experience in IT Infrastructure;

✅Experience in AWS, GitLab, Docker, and Kubernetes;

✅Strong knowledge of Python for scripting;

✅English fluency;

✅Hybrid work in Porto, Portugal.


What do we offer?


✅Integration into an international company that is growing daily;

✅Constant training in the latest and most innovative technologies - Prime Academy;

✅Coaching and career progression.


📩 Send your CV to ldmiranda@primeit.pt and join the PrimeIT team!

Title: Desenvolvedor full stack
Description:
A RACELAND Automação, uma subsidiária da renomada produtora internacional de veículos personalizados RACELAND S.A., está à procura de um talentoso Desenvolvedor Full Stack para se juntar à nossa equipa inovadora. Atuamos no desenvolvimento de soluções de automação residencial e empresarial, utilizando e contribuindo igualmente com softwares de código aberto.




Descrição da Função:

Como Desenvolvedor Full Stack, será responsável pelo desenvolvimento de aplicações web para marketplaces e ferramentas internas direcionadas a agências de viagem, operadores de turismo e rentacars. Procuramos alguém com paixão pela programação, espírito de equipa e vontade de aprender e crescer connosco.




Responsabilidades:

- Desenvolver e manter aplicações web e móveis.

- Colaborar com as equipas de design e produto para criar soluções inovadoras e eficientes.

- Garantir a qualidade do código e a implementação das melhores práticas de desenvolvimento.

- Participar em revisões de código e fornecer feedback construtivo.

- Contribuir para a evolução da nossa arquitetura de software e das nossas práticas de desenvolvimento.




Requisitos:

- Experiência comprovada em desenvolvimento Full Stack.

- Proficiência em linguagens de programação: Typescript, Javascript, Python, Java e Go.

- Experiência com bases de dados Postgres.

- Conhecimentos sólidos em React, React Native / Expo.

- Familiaridade com Docker para gestão de ambientes de desenvolvimento.

- Experiência com controlo de versões Git, preferencialmente GitHub.

- Conhecimentos em Supabase são uma mais-valia.

- Capacidade de trabalhar de forma autónoma e em equipa.

- Boa capacidade de comunicação e resolução de problemas.




Oferecemos:

- Ambiente de trabalho dinâmico e inovador.

- Oportunidades de crescimento e desenvolvimento profissional.

- Participação em projetos desafiantes e de grande impacto.

- Remuneração compatível com a experiência e desempenho demonstrado.




Caso esteja interessado e nos queira ajudar entre em contacto connosco.
